The discussion will be presented below, followed by my opinion.Some people say that mere studying does not youth for a country. This way, students only earn theoretical knowledge not practical. For instance, students can be their studies but at the same time when they , they fail and cannot develop their confidence and work as brilliantly as they were in university. Hence, the best approach for them to be engaged here and there for practical experience.On the other hand, others believe that building a better career is the foremost thing in today’s world. So, they are targeted to their studies and gain as much knowledge as they can. Furthermore, if they are diverted from their studies, they will not be able to their .In my point of view, there must be blending of full time education and extra activities. It refreshes students’ minds and provides more energy . Moreover, by this way, they will learn how to with other people in the society.To summarize, it can be said that it is important to concentrate on but on the other hand there must be something to keep active and relaxed being involved in games, music, work and other extra activities.
llm: Pursuing full-time university studies is a valuable life experience, but it can be complemented by other activities, such as part-time work, sports, debates, and other extracurricular pursuits. Opinions differ on whether students should focus solely on their studies or engage in other activities. The following discussion will present various perspectives, followed by my personal opinion.Some argue that merely studying does not prepare young people for the demands of the real world. By only acquiring theoretical knowledge, students lack practical experience. For example, students may excel in their studies, but when faced with real-world challenges, they may struggle and fail to develop the confidence and skills they need to succeed. Therefore, the best approach is for students to balance their studies with other activities to gain practical experience.On the other hand, others believe that building a successful career is the top priority in today's competitive world. As a result, they focus exclusively on their studies, aiming to acquire as much knowledge as possible. Moreover, if they are distracted from their studies, they may not achieve their academic goals.In my opinion, there should be a balance between full-time education and extracurricular activities. This balance refreshes students' minds, provides them with more energy, and teaches them how to interact with others in society.In summary, it is essential to focus on studies, but it is also important to stay active and relaxed by engaging in activities such as sports, music, part-time work, and other extracurricular pursuits. This balance is crucial for students' overall development and success.

question: Having a salaried job is better than being self-employed. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: If one wants to work for money, there are really only two options, working for someone else for a salary and being self-employed. Most people are involved with these two options and they both have advantages and disadvantages.Being self-employed means that the worker owns the business that is being done. This might be a small one-person business or a large company with hundreds of employees. The first advantage of this is the capacity to earn more money. If the business does very well, the income can be considerable and the owner of the company will receive the benefits. On the other hand, if business is not good, the owner’s income will be low. Self-employed people also have the benefit to some extent of choosing their working hours and holidays and they have the right to change anything within their business. With this autonomy, however, comes the pressure to succeed and the reliance on one’s employees, if there are any, to do their best to make the business thrive.Salaried workers do not experience the same stress as the self-employed owners of companies. They might have stress in their duties, but the pressure that comes with keeping one’s own business operating successfully in order to support oneself and one’s family is just not felt by an employee. The employee also has a certain knowledge of his or her income, as the salary is usually fixed every month. The self-employed owner’s income often depends on how successful the business is. The employee’s fixed income, however, does not give much scope for earning large amounts more. In addition, an employee does not have the freedoms of the owner or the autonomy, and for many people, having control over their lives is a significant factor to their well-being.It is certain that there are advantages and disadvantages for both being self-employed and salaried. I personally disagree that being salaried is better than being self-employed. I prefer the autonomy that being self-employed brings and, although there is more risk and pressure, this can lead to greater and more fulfilling rewards.
llm: When it comes to earning a living, individuals essentially have two options: working for someone else in exchange for a salary or being self-employed. The majority of people fall into one of these two categories, each with its own set of advantages and disadvantages.Self-employment means being the owner of the business, which can range from a small, one-person operation to a large corporation with hundreds of employees. One of the primary benefits of self-employment is the potential to earn a higher income. If the business is successful, the owner can reap significant financial rewards. However, if the business struggles, the owner's income will suffer accordingly. Self-employed individuals also have the flexibility to choose their working hours and vacations, as well as the autonomy to make changes within their business. This independence comes with a price, though - the pressure to succeed and the reliance on employees (if any) to perform well and contribute to the business's success.In contrast, salaried workers do not experience the same level of stress as self-employed business owners. While they may encounter stress in their job responsibilities, they do not bear the burden of keeping their own business afloat to support themselves and their families. Salaried workers also have the security of a fixed monthly income, whereas the self-employed owner's income is often tied to the business's performance. Although this fixed income provides stability, it also limits the potential for significant financial gains. Additionally, salaried workers lack the freedoms and autonomy that come with being a business owner, which can be a crucial factor in overall well-being for many individuals.Ultimately, both self-employment and salaried work have their advantages and disadvantages. Personally, I disagree with the notion that being salaried is superior to being self-employed. I value the autonomy that comes with self-employment and, despite the increased risk and pressure, believe it can lead to more substantial and fulfilling rewards.

question: High-rise vs. low-rise buildings, which solution is better for a growing population?
human: Some cities create new housing for their growing populations by constructing a smaller number of high-rise buildings. Other cities create more of low-rise buildings. Which solution is better, in your opinion?Sample EssayRising population in urban areas leaves governments with no choice but to build more houses to meet the demand. However, when it comes to construction, there is more than one way to build new homes. Some cities prefer to construct fewer residential towers, while others build a larger number of low-rises for their residents. In this essay both options will be discussed and a viable solution will be suggested.One advantage of tall buildings is that they can accommodate a large number of people while having a small footprint. This type of construction is popular in central city areas where land is scarce and expensive. For example, in New York City high-rise buildings have significantly reduced housing problems, by as much as 55% in the last few years. As a result of this strategy, rents tend to decrease which has a further positive impact on the economies of such cities. However, tall buildings offer little or no privacy, they force certain rules and regulations upon residents, and attract higher maintenance costs.Given a chance to voice their opinion, many individuals would prefer to live in low-rise buildings or even build their own houses. This option might be more attractive for big families and for older generation people who like to have their own personal space. Accessibility is also a concern for the elderly as taking the stairs when the lifts break down may not be an option for them. In addition, one or two-story houses are easier and cheaper to maintain compared to modern apartment towers. The downside of this type of dwellings is that they occupy much more land, and since land is cheaper on city fringes, new estates tend to be built away from city centres. This increases commute time to work for their residents and negatively affects their quality of life.In conclusion, high-rise and low-rise buildings have their unique advantages and disadvantages. In my opinion, high rises are more suitable for younger residents and should be built in the areas where young population is prevalent, closer to the city centre and employment opportunities. Senior citizens should have a supply of lower dwellings available in quieter locations. Such flexible approach can be a good way to address the needs of growing city’s population.
llm: The increasing population in urban areas has led governments to seek solutions to meet the rising demand for housing. Two common approaches are to construct either a small number of high-rise buildings or a larger number of low-rise buildings. In this essay, we will discuss the pros and cons of both options and suggest a viable solution.One of the advantages of high-rise buildings is their ability to accommodate a large number of residents while occupying a relatively small area of land. This makes them an attractive option for central city areas where land is scarce and expensive. For instance, in New York City, the construction of high-rise buildings has led to a significant reduction in housing shortages, with a decrease of up to 55% in recent years. As a result, rents have decreased, which has had a positive impact on the local economy. However, high-rise buildings have their drawbacks, including limited privacy, strict rules and regulations, and higher maintenance costs.On the other hand, many individuals prefer to live in low-rise buildings or have their own houses. This option is particularly appealing to large families and older adults who value their personal space. Additionally, low-rise buildings are generally more accessible for the elderly, who may struggle with stairs in the event of a lift breakdown. Furthermore, one or two-story houses are easier and more cost-effective to maintain compared to high-rise apartment towers. Nevertheless, low-rise buildings occupy more land, which can lead to the development of new estates on the outskirts of cities, increasing commute times and negatively affecting residents' quality of life.In conclusion, both high-rise and low-rise buildings have their unique advantages and disadvantages. In my opinion, high-rise buildings are more suitable for younger residents and should be constructed in areas with a high concentration of young people, closer to city centers and job opportunities. On the other hand, senior citizens should have access to lower-rise dwellings in quieter locations. A flexible approach that caters to the diverse needs of a growing city's population could be an effective way to address the housing shortage. Alternatively, here is a more significant rewrite of the text:The world's cities are experiencing unprecedented growth, with populations swelling and putting pressure on housing stocks. To address this challenge, urban planners are exploring different construction strategies. Two dominant approaches have emerged: building a small number of high-rise buildings or constructing a larger number of low-rise buildings. This essay will examine the pros and cons of each approach and propose a solution that balances the needs of diverse urban populations.High-rise buildings offer a

question: IELTS Essay, topic: Some believe that modern technology is increasing the gap between the rich and poor, while others disagree (discuss)
human: Some believe that modern technology is increasing the gap between rich and poor people, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.There is no doubt that modern technology is reshaping our planet and affecting every aspect of human lives. From a social perspective, many people argue that the gap between the upper class and lower classes is widening as a result of technological advancements. Others, however, believe the opposite.There are several reasons why one could think that the wealth inequality is, indeed, increasing. The most common reason is automation. Driven by technology, automation reduces the need for manual labour. As a result, less work opportunities are available for unskilled people. With each iteration of the cycle the competition increases and wages decrease. , technology has increased the minimum level of needs that should be satisfied. Nowadays, everybody should have a mobile phone and an internet connection, including the poor. This increases the monetary burden on them as they must borrow to cover these new needs.However, I firmly believe that the aforementioned opinion is ludicrous. The most obvious reason is that modern technology has facilitated the road to riches in an unprecedented manner. For instance, many of the internet billionaires are from lower and middle classes. Moreover, the major leaps in agricultural technologies magnified food production. As a result, food has become more affordable and available. Finally, leveraging technology has dramatically increased workers’ productivity. Consequently, compensations and salaries have increased.In conclusion, I strongly believe that technology could possibly narrow the difference between social classes. Increased food production, opportunities and productivity are just few examples of technology’s contribution to bridging the wealth gap.This essay adequately covers all parts of the task. The ideas expressed in this written response are relevant, well-developed, ordered in a logical way and supported. The paragraphing is suitable and cohesion is maintained throughout the essay. A good range of vocabulary and the writer’s fluency are evident. There are no spelling errors and very few mistakes in word choice and grammar, most sentences are error-free. The essay is likely to get Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: The debate about whether modern technology is exacerbating the disparity between the rich and the poor has sparked intense discussion, with some advocating for the notion that it widens the gap, while others contend the opposite. This essay aims to delve into both perspectives and provide an opinion on the matter.From a societal standpoint, a plethora of individuals argue that technological advancements are contributing to the widening chasm between the affluent and the impoverished. On the other hand, there are those who firmly believe that technology is bridging this gap. Several compelling arguments suggest that the wealth disparity is indeed increasing due to technological progress. A primary concern is the rise of automation, driven by technological innovation, which diminishes the necessity for manual labor. As a consequence, fewer job opportunities are available for unskilled workers, leading to heightened competition and decreased wages. Furthermore, technology has elevated the baseline of necessities, with modern society deeming it essential for everyone, including the poor, to possess a mobile phone and internet connection. This imposes an additional financial burden, as they are compelled to borrow to meet these novel needs.However, the opinion that technology is widening the wealth gap is, in my opinion, misguided. A more plausible perspective is that modern technology has unprecedentedly facilitated social mobility. For instance, numerous internet billionaires have emerged from lower and middle-class backgrounds, exemplifying the potential for technological innovation to foster economic ascent. Moreover, significant advancements in agricultural technology have substantially increased food production, rendering it more affordable and accessible. Lastly, the strategic leveraging of technology has dramatically augmented worker productivity, culminating in enhanced compensations and salaries.In conclusion, I firmly believe that technology has the potential to narrow the socioeconomic divide. The proliferation of opportunities, increased food production, and heightened productivity are testaments to technology's role in bridging the wealth disparity. This perspective is grounded in the empirical evidence that technological innovation has empowered individuals from diverse backgrounds to ascend the economic ladder and has improved the overall standard of living. Ultimately, the benefits of technology can be harnessed to create a more equitable society, where the gap between the rich and the poor is continually diminishing.

question: In many countries children are engaged in some kind of paid work. Some people regard this as completely wrong, while others consider it a valuable work experience, which is important for learning and taking responsibility. What is your opinion?
human: Nowadays, many children involved in different types of jobs to have some kind of financial assurance for themselves. However, whether this is good for their development and personality is a controversial issue. I personally believe that paid works is harmful for children for several reasons.It is said that children gain valuable experience in the work place. This may be true. However, I would argue that children are mainly employed in jobs that require manual work and are poorly paid. The recent statistics reveal the common tasks that children are assigned to are washing dishes, mopping floors or serving food in restaurants. Meanwhile, this kind of jobs actually provide children with necessary and useful skills to apply in their future .This brings me to the second point. Defenders of child labour that it is an effective method of learning. The point is children should be able to apply knowledge taught to them in a real life working environment. Although this is undoubtedly true, it also means that children may neglect the classroom study and even fail the class. The worst thing is yet to come. They may become so preoccupied with the benefits ahead of them such as small salary that they may leave school.Finally, supporters say that it helps them to build responsibility in the family. They will understand how it is difficult to earn money and therefore have compassion for their parents. This is true to a certain extent, but may have a totally adverse effect on children. As children can make money at an early age, they would feel that it is appropriate to spend it on luxury things.In conclusion, I think that parents should take measures to restrict their child from work, otherwise it would have negative consequences to their future.
llm: In today's society, many children are engaged in various types of jobs to secure some form of financial stability for themselves. However, the question of whether this is beneficial for their development and personality remains a topic of debate. Personally, I believe that paid work is detrimental to children for several reasons.While it is argued that children gain valuable experience in the workplace, I would counter that most child labor involves manual work and is poorly paid. Recent statistics show that common tasks assigned to children include washing dishes, mopping floors, or serving food in restaurants. Although these jobs may provide children with useful skills for their future, they are often not the kind of work that fosters intellectual or emotional growth.This leads me to my second point: the argument that child labor is an effective method of learning. Proponents claim that children should be able to apply the knowledge they have learned in a real-life working environment. While it is true that hands-on experience can be valuable, it also means that children may neglect their classroom studies and even fail their classes. The worst outcome is that they may become so preoccupied with the benefits of earning a small salary that they drop out of school altogether.Lastly, supporters of child labor argue that it helps children develop a sense of responsibility within their family. By understanding the difficulties of earning money, they may develop compassion for their parents' struggles. Although this may be true to some extent, it can also have an adverse effect on children. If children can earn money at a young age, they may feel entitled to spend it on luxuries, rather than saving or using it wisely.In conclusion, I firmly believe that parents should take steps to restrict their child from working, as it can have severe negative consequences on their future development and well-being. It is crucial for parents and society as a whole to prioritize children's education and personal growth over the short-term benefits of child labor.

question: In many countries children are engaged in some kind of paid work. Some people regard this as completely wrong, while others consider it to be a valuable work experience, which is important for learning and taking responsibility. What is your opinion on this?
human: In the Third World, children are usually sent to factories for laborious work. Many people believe that it is merely exploitation, while others think it is a good opportunity for them to life experience. In any case, children have their right to live and study in peaceful conditions. Therefore, using them as workforce is considered an unacceptable action.First of all, children are not workers. They have just learned about the vast world and do not have any experience or concept of working. Since these innocent children are naive and , they can be easily cheated and exploited. There are many examples of this in poor nations. Because using children is cheap and to control, many enterprises hire them and don’t pay them much. Although the government in these countries has tried its best, this kind of taking advantage of children cannot be eliminated.Moreover, children do not need such thing as ‘valuable work experience’ that is supposedly ‘important for learning and taking responsibility’. The brief responsibility of children is learning. They are not old enough to understand what working experiences are. Nevertheless, they can help parents do chores or housework. This will be a much better way for them to become more responsible for . In addition, childhood is one of the most remarkable memories and must not be taken away by forcing them to work.In conclusion, since all children are the great concern of parent and society, they should be allowed to enjoy life and rather than to work. Hence, one must ponder what view is actually appropriate for the sake of the children.
llm: In developing countries, it is a common practice to send children to factories to perform demanding labor. While some people view this as a valuable learning experience, others see it as outright exploitation. Regardless of perspective, children have the fundamental right to live and study in peaceful environments, making their use as a workforce unacceptable.Children are not suited for work, having only recently begun to explore the world and lacking the experience and understanding of what it means to work. Their innocence and naivety make them vulnerable to exploitation, as evidenced by numerous examples in impoverished nations. Companies often take advantage of this, hiring children at low costs and exerting control over them with minimal compensation. Despite government efforts to combat this issue, the exploitation of children persists.Moreover, children do not require "valuable work experience" to learn and take responsibility. Their primary responsibility is to learn, and they are not yet mature enough to comprehend the concept of work experience. However, assisting their parents with household chores can be a more suitable way for them to develop a sense of responsibility. Furthermore, childhood is a precious and memorable time that should not be sacrificed by forcing children into labor.In conclusion, considering the well-being of children is a top priority for both parents and society, they should be allowed to enjoy their childhood and focus on their education rather than being forced to work. Ultimately, it is essential to reflect on what approach is truly in the best interest of children.

question: In many countries people increasingly talk about money (how much they earn or how much they pay for things in their daily conversations). Why? Is this a positive or negative development?
human: Money can not buy happiness! Is one of the most famous sayings while talking about finances. It is argued that topics around money, wealth, and poverty are becoming dramatically more frequent between humans in different countries around the world. In my opinion, the extream part of it is a negative development; although, it has some positivities. I will address some of both sides in this essay.Talking about money during the major part of the day might make the person look stingy and this is an attitude that majority of the community would not like, thus, might effect on the person's social life. Moreover, having the same topic in mind all day might lead to an obsession, and as a result, this could lead to a depression because the person might not find the proper way to reach to the financial position that meets their satisfaction, which could lead to depression, or even worse such as going through illegal paths where it could destroy their lives entirely!Nevertheless, the person should be aware of his /her income and spendings and try to enhance their financial position to the best possible way. Also, the inflation that we are currently living and the noticable increase in prices could be a driver for people to talk about money more often.In conclusion, people should not be obssessed in money and to talk with everyone about it all the time. However, I believe that people should discuss this matter in order to benefit from each other, and to find more ways to enhance their quality of life.
llm: The age-old adage "Money can't buy happiness" is a popular saying when discussing financial matters. The topic of money, wealth, and poverty has become increasingly prevalent in conversations among people from different countries worldwide. In my opinion, the extreme focus on this topic has both negative and positive aspects, which I will explore in this essay.Excessive discussion of money can have negative consequences on a person's social life, as it may give the impression of being stingy, an attitude that is often frowned upon by the community. Moreover, constant preoccupation with financial matters can lead to an unhealthy obsession, potentially resulting in depression. This is because the individual may become fixated on achieving a financial status that meets their expectations, and if they fail to do so, they may resort to desperate measures, including illegal activities that can have devastating consequences.On the other hand, it is essential for individuals to be aware of their income and expenses, and to strive to improve their financial situation in a responsible and sustainable way. The current economic climate, marked by inflation and rising prices, can also motivate people to discuss financial matters more frequently. By sharing knowledge and experiences, individuals can learn from each other and discover new ways to enhance their quality of life.In conclusion, while an excessive focus on money can be detrimental, I believe that discussing financial matters can be beneficial when done in moderation. By striking a balance between being mindful of one's financial situation and not becoming overly obsessed with it, individuals can reap the benefits of sharing experiences and knowledge, ultimately leading to a better quality of life.

question: In many countries women and men are working full time. It is therefore, logical for women and men to share household works. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: I strongly agree with this statement. If women and men are both working full time, they should share household works.First of all, if women and men are working full time, and they are working in the same amount of time, logically, the amount of time they do household works should be the sam e. However, if one of them work for longer hours, the household works should still be shared but the other one should do more household works.Second of all, everyone have responsibility to do household works because everyone lives in the house, makes the house dirty, creates dirty clothes and dishes. If there is only either women or men doing household works, it is not fair at all, because they both work full time.But as I mentioned before, the amount of time doing household works can be arranged, it doesn't have to be evenly shared. For instance, if the woman in this family work for longer hours or got an extra call by work, the man should help and do her part of household works. And when the man are working more, the woman should do the same. This does not only solve the problem of who should do household works but can also show that women and men are supporting each other in various situations.In conclusion, when women and men are both doing full time jobs, they should share household works. But it doesn't have to to be split in two halves, it can have alternatives depending on the working hours or special situations. In this way, the house can be more peaceful and have more harmony without arguments about who should do the household works.
llm: I wholeheartedly endorse the idea that women and men should share household responsibilities when they both work full-time. Logically, if they dedicate the same amount of time to their jobs, they should also allocate equal time to household chores. However, if one partner works longer hours, it's reasonable to adjust the distribution of household tasks accordingly, with the other partner taking on more responsibilities.It's essential to recognize that both women and men have a responsibility to contribute to household work, as they both reside in the house, generate mess, and create dirty laundry and dishes. Assigning household tasks solely to one partner is unfair, especially when both work full-time. A more equitable approach is to share the workload, taking into account the specific circumstances of each partner's work schedule.The division of household labor doesn't necessarily need to be a 50-50 split. Rather, it can be adapted to accommodate varying work hours or special situations. For instance, if the woman in the household works longer hours or receives an unexpected work call, the man can step in to assist with her share of the household tasks. Conversely, when the man is working extended hours, the woman can reciprocate by taking on more household responsibilities. This not only resolves the issue of who should perform household tasks but also demonstrates the mutual support and cooperation between partners in diverse situations.In conclusion, when women and men both work full-time, sharing household responsibilities is crucial for maintaining harmony and peace in the home. The key is to find a balance that works for both partners, taking into account their unique circumstances and work schedules. By doing so, households can become more peaceful and collaborative, free from disputes over who should perform household tasks.

question: In many countries young people start living on their own after high school, is this a positive or negative development?
human: In many countries around the world young people decide to leave their parents’ home once they finish school. They start living on their own or sharing a house with friends. Is this a positive or a negative development? Give reasons for your answer and include relevant examples.Sample EssayNowadays it is becoming increasingly common for youngsters to start their independent life by moving out of their parents’ home after graduation from school. This trend has positive effects on the society and the reasons behind it will be discussed next in this essay.There are various benefits for both young people and their parents when individuals start living independently after finishing school. Young adults, in this way, have to take care of their daily needs, from house chores, cooking or cleaning to financial independence. Thus, instead of wasting time on childish activities, they are motivated to learn skills and work part-time or full-time in order to cover their living expenses. Although it might seem challenging for them to live on their own at first, it would give them valuable experience, helping them to become mature, responsible adults. Parents would also be pleased with this practice since they can enjoy their own lives by having more time for themselves. Not only would they have more financial flexibility due to independence of their children, but they also don’t have to change their habits in order to adapt to the new generation’s lifestyle. For instance, it allows many people to travel around the world, which would be impossible if their children were to stay with them after finishing high school.Admittedly, there might be some challenges involved in this way of life. In some cases and especially under the influence of new friends or housemates, youngsters might choose to get involved in dangerous activities that involve drugs or petty crimes. However, instead of keeping their children close through adulthood, parents should prepare in advance and raise their children to distinguish between right and wrong and teach them to take responsibility for their actions.In conclusion, although there might be some adverse consequences to this relatively new practice, I believe that the advantages of young people leaving family home outweigh its drawbacks, for both children and parents.
llm: In many countries, it has become a common practice for young people to leave their family home after completing their education. They often choose to live independently or share a house with friends. But is this trend a positive or negative development? This essay will argue that it is a positive development, providing reasons and examples to support this claim.The decision of young adults to start living independently after finishing school has numerous benefits for both themselves and their parents. By taking care of their daily needs, such as household chores, cooking, and cleaning, as well as managing their finances, young adults are motivated to acquire new skills and secure part-time or full-time employment to cover their living expenses. Although the initial transition to independent living may be challenging, it provides valuable experience that helps them mature into responsible adults. Meanwhile, parents can enjoy their own lives, having more time for themselves and greater financial flexibility due to their children's independence. For example, many people can travel the world, which would be difficult if their children were still living with them after high school.While there are potential challenges associated with this lifestyle, such as the risk of young people engaging in dangerous activities like drug use or petty crimes under the influence of new friends or housemates, parents should prepare their children in advance to make responsible decisions. Rather than keeping their children close through adulthood, parents should teach them to distinguish right from wrong and take responsibility for their actions.In conclusion, despite some potential drawbacks, the advantages of young people leaving the family home after finishing school outweigh the disadvantages, benefiting both the children and the parents. This trend promotes independence, responsibility, and personal growth, ultimately leading to a more mature and self-sufficient younger generation.

question: In many countries, a lot of food is wasted. Why do people waste food? How can we reduce the amount of food waste?
human: Despite the fact that millions of people in the world go hungry every day, a surprisingly large amount of food gets wasted daily in certain parts of the world. In my opinion, the main reason for this is that people in the first-world countries tend to only buy food that is aesthetically pleasing, and fortunately, there are some ways to tackle this issue.It is shockingly sad to know that large amounts of perfectly edible food in the form of fresh produce get sent to landfills, and the main reason for this is that these foods do not meet the standards of perfection set for fruits and vegetables by consumers and grocery stores. For example, veggies and fruit that are misshapen or have a few spots on them are still good enough to eat, yet they are often left on shelves to rot in favour of something that looks less damaged. In addition, a lot of customers confuse the ‘best by’ and ‘use by’ dates, thinking that foods that have passed their ‘best by’ dates are no longer fit to eat. Another major reason for food wastage is that people often overestimate the amount of produce they require on a weekly or monthly basis, and most of it ends up getting thrown out instead of being used.There are many ways to reduce the amount of food being wasted, and I think one of the best ideas is to increase people’s awareness of just how much good food is disposed of, only because of our superficial biases as to how food should look. Raising the awareness of the staggering number of people that go hungry in third-world countries would make it harder to throw away an apple just because it is a little bruised. Also, teaching people how to better plan their monthly food requirements would help them not to overspend on food that they do not need; it would be great for the environment and their budget. The role of the government in this endeavour is indispensable as such task would be too great for any smaller organisation.To conclude, the wasting food is a serious issue that merits increased awareness from both people and the leaders of the world. It is unacceptable to discard any food when there are so many people who are starving, and hopefully our joint effort can help improve the current situation.
llm: It is alarming to note that, despite widespread hunger affecting millions of people globally, a substantial amount of food is wasted daily in certain regions. In my view, the primary cause of this issue is the tendency of individuals in developed countries to prioritize the aesthetic appeal of food, but fortunately, there are potential solutions to address this problem.The fact that large quantities of perfectly edible food, including fresh produce, are discarded in landfills is disturbing. This occurs because these items fail to meet the stringent standards of perfection imposed by consumers and grocery stores. For instance, vegetables and fruits that are misshapen or have minor blemishes are still suitable for consumption, yet they are often left to spoil in favor of more visually appealing alternatives. Furthermore, many consumers mistakenly interpret the 'best by' and 'use by' dates, believing that food past its 'best by' date is no longer edible. Another significant contributor to food waste is the common practice of overestimating weekly or monthly produce requirements, resulting in a substantial portion being discarded.To mitigate food waste, I believe that raising awareness about the extent of good food discarded due to superficial biases regarding appearance is crucial. By acknowledging the vast number of people struggling with hunger in underdeveloped countries, it becomes more difficult to justify discarding food based on minor imperfections. Additionally, educating individuals on how to better plan their food needs can help prevent overspending on unnecessary items, which would be beneficial for both the environment and personal budgets. The government's role in this endeavor is vital, as the task is too significant for smaller organizations to tackle alone.In conclusion, food waste is a pressing issue that demands increased awareness from both the general public and global leaders. It is unacceptable to discard food when millions of people are struggling with hunger. Hopefully, our collective efforts can contribute to improving the current situation and reducing the staggering amount of food waste.

question: In many countries, young people are finding it harder and harder to find permanent jobs. Why is this happening? What can be done to improve the situation?
human: In this fast-moving age, with the development of education and modern technologies, people strive to have a secure job after graduating from colleges and universities. Despite their efforts, so many young adults in different parts of the world have a negative experience of finding a long-term job.It so happens that most colleges and universities focus on students’ academic performance much more than their practical skills. Unfortunately, many companies reserve permanent job opportunities for experienced applicants because there is no need to invest much in their training. Lack of practical experience in new graduates puts them at a disadvantage as far as companies are concerned. The situation is made worse by the abundance of advanced technologies that can easily replace human labor. Robots and computers work more efficiently and with higher precision than humans. That shrinks the pool of available job placements even more, as companies only need to hire highly educated and experienced staff.Fortunately, there is a number of solutions that can help inexperienced workers gain permanent employment. An obvious one is that universities could offer internships to their students, or arrange workshops in addition to classwork. This would help students to get training and experience in their respective fields. Also, the government could examine the demands of changing labor market and steer young people towards professions that will be popular in the coming years. Together with colleges and universities the government could create special awareness programs for graduates, providing them with an overview of various job offers and their benefits. This way students would be able to choose the right jobs for themselves.To sum up, lack of demand in the labour market and insufficient experience are two major reasons why many young people have trouble finding a permanent position. Helping them gain hands-on experience as part of their studies and educating them about career options early on is key to improving the employment outcome for them.
llm: In today's fast-paced world, where education and technology are constantly evolving, people are eager to secure a stable job after graduating from college or university. However, many young adults worldwide face significant challenges in finding long-term employment. The primary issue lies in the fact that most educational institutions prioritize academic achievement over practical skills, leaving new graduates with limited experience. As a result, companies tend to reserve permanent positions for seasoned applicants, as they require less training and investment. The lack of practical experience among new graduates puts them at a disadvantage in the eyes of employers. Furthermore, the increasing presence of advanced technologies, such as robots and computers, which can perform tasks more efficiently and accurately than humans, exacerbates the situation. This reduces the number of available job openings, as companies only need to hire highly educated and experienced personnel.Fortunately, there are potential solutions that can aid inexperienced workers in securing permanent employment. One approach is for universities to offer internships or workshops in conjunction with regular coursework, enabling students to gain hands-on experience in their respective fields. Additionally, the government could analyze the demands of the changing labor market and guide young people towards professions that are likely to be in high demand in the future. In collaboration with educational institutions, the government could establish awareness programs for graduates, providing them with an overview of various job opportunities and their benefits. This would enable students to make informed decisions about their career paths.In conclusion, the lack of demand in the labor market and insufficient experience are the primary reasons why many young people struggle to find permanent employment. Providing them with hands-on experience as part of their studies and educating them about career options from an early stage is crucial to improving their employment prospects. By addressing these issues, we can empower young adults to secure stable and fulfilling careers.

question: In many workplaces online communication has overtaken face to face meetings. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
human: In today’s ever-increasingly digital world, online communication has become the norm for many workplaces. While this development offers numerous advantages for companies such as greater flexibility and efficiency, it also brings with it certain disadvantages like miscommunication, which must be weighed against its benefits.One of the primary advantages of online communication is that it makes it easier for teams to stay in touch without having to physically convene. This is especially beneficial when individuals or groups are dispersed across vast distances. Reduced travel costs, as well as time saved from not having to travel to and from meetings, also represent meaningful savings for businesses. Additionally, online communication platforms often have a range of features designed to make collaboration more efficient, such as providing an easy way to share documents and other materials with remote team members. To illustrate, digital resources can be sent quickly and securely via email or other software services like Dropbox or Google Drive.There is a potential drawback associated with relying too heavily on online communication at work, as the lack of physical proximity between members of a team can often lead to misunderstandings due to a loss of context or nonverbal cues that would otherwise be present during face-to-face meetings. However, in my opinion, issues of this nature can be solved by using written language more carefully to avoid any confusion or miscommunication among colleagues.In conclusion, when online communication tools are used properly, they undoubtedly provide companies with greater flexibility in how their teams collaborate without sacrificing clarity of communication, quality or efficiency.
llm: The shift towards a digital world has led to the widespread adoption of online communication in many workplaces. While this trend offers numerous benefits, including increased flexibility and efficiency, it also presents certain drawbacks, such as the potential for miscommunication. To fully appreciate the value of online communication, it is essential to weigh these advantages and disadvantages.One of the most significant benefits of online communication is its ability to facilitate seamless communication among team members, regardless of their physical location. This is particularly advantageous for teams that are geographically dispersed. The reduction in travel costs and time spent commuting to and from meetings also translates to substantial savings for businesses. Moreover, online communication platforms typically offer a range of features designed to enhance collaboration, including the ability to easily share documents and materials with remote team members. For instance, digital resources can be swiftly and securely shared via email or cloud storage services like Dropbox or Google Drive.However, there is a potential downside to relying excessively on online communication in the workplace. The lack of face-to-face interaction can lead to misunderstandings due to the absence of nonverbal cues and contextual information that are typically present in in-person meetings. Nevertheless, in my view, these issues can be mitigated by using written language with greater care and precision to avoid confusion and miscommunication among colleagues.In summary, when utilized effectively, online communication tools undoubtedly provide companies with greater flexibility in team collaboration without compromising communication clarity, quality, or efficiency. By leveraging these tools, businesses can harness the benefits of online communication while minimizing its drawbacks.

question: In many workplaces, online communication is getting more common than meeting face to face. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
human: According to COVID-19 event forced many company to change their way of working. One of the most significant transformation is the communication. The online communication becomes a must or inevitable for the company to be implemented. In this topic, we're going to disscuss the advantages and disadvantages for both ways of communications. The online meeting can introduce a significant impact to the organization while face to face meeting can be outdated for this new era of 2021.First of all for the online communication's advantages is that in the pandemic period the actual physical contact is a significant way to transmit the disease. Video conference can help mitigate this problem by lower the physical contact for each conversation or meeting. Also communicates through online channel can help individual to organize or manage their time efficiently according to each person preference. For example, a single mom parent may be able to spend times for her sons/daughters at home, while be able to have a cross country meeting with another department in other region. Another reason is that some people are quite introvert and find it difficult for face to face human interactions or conversations, in which online chat or messages can help them to mitigate this problem and communicate efficiently. Lastly as mentioned about video conference across region, online meeting can help the multi-national corporates save the transporations cost and additional resources needed to spend for face to face meeting.For the disadvantages, all of the online communications required hardware, internet connection and technological knowledge on how to use them. This technological gap can be seen as one of the most significant obstracle or disadvantage for people to use online communications. For example, in one company, there obviously have a various age of people, in which some of them are not familiar with the technology. Since video call conference has been introduced and utilized widespread among corporates not so long time ago. This can be a big technological gap for some people to use the online communications and result in a lost in communications among the workplaces.As a result, online communication helps an organization to reduce the risk of transmitting the disease, improved the time mangement ability and productivity for each individuals, and lower the financial cost or resources required to spends for international business activities. With all these advantages of online communication stated, they can be seens as a significant reasons to outweight the disadvantages of technological gap on this current year of 2021.
llm: The COVID-19 pandemic has forced many companies to reassess their work processes, with one of the most notable transformations being in communication. Online communication has become an essential tool for companies to adopt. This discussion will explore the advantages and disadvantages of both online and face-to-face communication methods, considering the significant impact of online meetings on organizations and the potential outdated nature of in-person meetings in the modern era.The advantages of online communication are multifaceted. During the pandemic, reducing physical contact is crucial to prevent the spread of the disease, and video conferencing has been instrumental in minimizing face-to-face interactions. Online communication also enables individuals to manage their time more efficiently, according to their personal preferences. For instance, a single parent can attend to their children at home while participating in cross-country meetings with other departments. Additionally, online communication platforms, such as chat and messaging services, can facilitate communication for introverted individuals who may struggle with in-person interactions. Lastly, online meetings can help multinational corporations save on transportation costs and additional resources required for in-person meetings.However, there are also disadvantages to online communication. The requirement for specific hardware, a stable internet connection, and technological proficiency can pose significant obstacles. This technological gap can be particularly challenging for individuals who are not familiar with the necessary technology, such as older employees who may not have grown up with the latest advancements. The relatively recent widespread adoption of video conferencing technology can exacerbate this issue, resulting in communication breakdowns in the workplace.In conclusion, online communication offers numerous benefits, including reduced disease transmission risk, improved time management and productivity, and lower financial costs for international business activities. Despite the disadvantages associated with technological gaps, the advantages of online communication outweigh the drawbacks, making it a vital tool for companies in the current era. As the world continues to navigate the challenges posed by the pandemic, the adoption and effective use of online communication strategies will be crucial for the success and sustainability of organizations.

question: In recent years, the family structure has changed, as well as family roles. What are the changes occurring? Do you think these changes are positive or negative?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: In our modern days, families had witnessed a considerable change regarding their structure and the roles of individuals inside it. These changes are mainly the patriarchal structure that was dominating families in the past compared to a more balanced arrangement nowadays. In addition to that, there are more freedom and rights for women in recent years. And I believe its an advantageous development.Fathers used to be the only leaders of the families of past decades, however in recent days mothers had shared the leadership and started taking part in family decisions just like their partners. Also during recent decades women obtained greater deal of their civil rights which allowed them to take different roles from those that were common for females in the past decades. As an example, women can now own the family house, sign important documents, drive cars which were a breakthrough for women to be able to participate in family plannings and decisions.It appears to be an advantage to have women being able to be effective members of their families, that is because they can share responsibility, add their feminine qualities to the lives of their families as well as for them to be able to fulfill their own life by feeling the importance of their existence and their roles.As in a recent research that found families with women in them are happier, more content, and definitely healthier.In conclusion, the family system nowadays differs vastly from before, owing to the more roles that women are taking, and to the more rights and freedom they gained, and in my perspective it is a positive change.
llm: In today's modern era, families have undergone significant transformations in terms of their structure and the roles of individuals within them. Notably, the traditional patriarchal structure that once dominated family dynamics has given way to a more balanced and equitable arrangement. Furthermore, women have gained greater freedom and rights in recent years, which I firmly believe is a beneficial development.Historically, fathers were the sole leaders of families, whereas nowadays, mothers have assumed a more equal role in leadership and decision-making, alongside their partners. Over the past few decades, women have made tremendous strides in securing their civil rights, enabling them to pursue diverse roles that were previously inaccessible to them. For instance, women can now own property, sign important documents, and drive cars, which has been a groundbreaking milestone in their participation in family planning and decision-making.It is evident that having women as active and influential members of their families is a significant advantage. This is because they can share responsibilities, bring their unique feminine perspectives to family life, and fulfill their own potential by feeling valued and recognized in their roles. Research has recently shown that families with empowered women are generally happier, more content, and healthier.In conclusion, the contemporary family system has undergone a profound shift from its traditional counterpart, largely due to the expanding roles and increased rights and freedoms of women. From my perspective, this evolution is a decidedly positive change, one that has far-reaching benefits for families and society as a whole.

question: In some countries children have very strict rules of behavior, in other countries they are allowed to do almost anything they like. To what extent should children have to follow rules?

llm: Freedom plays a vital role in every individual's life, and in today's modern era, it's evident that people of all ages dislike being restricted. However, excessive restrictions can be counterproductive. By striking a balance between guidance and freedom, we can help children develop into good human beings, equipped with the values and principles necessary to succeed in life.

question: In some countries people spend long hours at work. Why does this happen? Is it positive or negative development
human: Nowadays, many businesses have to compete each other in order to survive from the rapidly changing world, leading to the high amount of time that employees spend on working. There are also other reasons why the employees work for a long period which I will discuss in this essay. In terms of consequences, I personally believe that spending most of our time at work is the negative development.It is the fact that people have various rationales to work for long hours. A classic example is the dynamic working condition. There are many companies that provide services such as consultation to customers, meaning that if their service does not completely satisfy the clients’ need, such client may decide to use the service from other competitors. Hence, the employees are required to dedicate their time to deliver the best service to the clients. Another common criticism is a bright career path. When the employees work for a long period, they can carefully check their works and, as a result, delivery the works with less mistakes. Doing this way could impress their manager and they are likely to get promotion in return.With a careful consideration regarding the consequence of working for long hours, there are many vital drawbacks. An obvious effect is the increase in illness. People who work very hard have to spend a lot of their time at work. Therefore, they may not have enough time to do exercises, weakening the immune system of their body. Furthermore, with the rise in the amount of working hours, people tend to lack social skills. This is because they may not be able to manage time to join social events or meet their friends, resulting in the less ability to adapt to new environments.In conclusion, it is undeniable that people work for long hours because of the requirement in business and personal career goal which, in my opinion, leads to negative development for themselves. This is because this behavior negatively affects their health condition and social competency which are the two most important aspects in our life.
llm: In today's fast-paced world, businesses are compelled to compete fiercely to survive, resulting in employees dedicating an excessive amount of time to their work. There are several reasons why employees work long hours, which will be explored in this essay. In my opinion, spending most of our time at work is a detrimental trend.People have various motivations for working long hours. One notable example is the dynamic nature of the work environment. Many companies offer services such as consulting, where failure to meet clients' needs can lead to a loss of business to competitors. Consequently, employees are required to devote significant time to delivering exceptional service to clients. Another common reason is the desire for career advancement. By working extended hours, employees can meticulously review their work, minimizing mistakes and increasing the likelihood of impressing their managers, which can lead to promotions.However, upon careful consideration of the consequences of working long hours, numerous significant drawbacks emerge. A glaring effect is the increased susceptibility to illness. Individuals who work excessively long hours often have insufficient time for physical exercise, weakening their immune system. Furthermore, the rise in working hours can lead to a decline in social skills, as people may not have time to attend social events or meet friends, resulting in reduced adaptability to new environments.In conclusion, it is undeniable that people work long hours due to business requirements and personal career goals, which, in my opinion, leads to negative consequences for themselves. This behavior adversely affects their physical and mental health, as well as their social competency, which are two of the most crucial aspects of life.

question: In some countries young people are encouraged to work or travel for a year between finishing high school and starting university studies. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages for young people who decide to do this .
human: Over decades, there has been a belief that adults should support adolescents to work in a company or travel to another country at least one year before going to university. Despite the fact that there are many positive aspects of having experiences in terms of working and travelling before studying at university, with a careful consideration, there are also negative points of this.It is true that working or travelling before starting a university program positively affects juveniles’ development. A classic example of this is an effective way to truly understand their academic preferences. When juveniles have work experiences, such as having a one-year internship in a company, they tend to learn a wide variety of work functions, helping them know the academic discipline they want to learn at university. Another benefit from taking a long journey to another place before studying at university is the opportunity to get exposed to new culture. This is because while adolescents are on an epic expedition to other parts of the world, they tend to meet new people with different nationality and belief, leading to valuable life experiences that they cannot receive from a professor at university.In spite of the aforementioned advantages of working or travelling before starting university courses, there are also drawbacks. A common example of this is graduating from a college late, compared to juveniles who immediately start a university program after they finish high school. This is exemplified by Thai culture which believes that young people who graduate from university later than their peer would not have a successful career path. In addition, opponents of this notion might argue that working before finishing university is not well worth doing. Since most works require a strong academic foundation in order for juveniles to deliver results with fewer mistakes, the juveniles should study at university instead.In conclusion, it is undeniable that having work experiences or taking a journey before starting a university life has many benefits for young people with respect to knowing the academic fields they want to study and learning new cultures outside a classroom. Nevertheless, doing this could also have drawbacks in terms of the delay in university graduation and an ineffective performance in working.
llm: For decades, the notion that adults should encourage adolescents to work or travel for at least a year before attending university has been prevalent. While there are numerous benefits to gaining work and travel experience before starting university, a closer examination also reveals several drawbacks.It is undeniable that working or traveling before beginning university studies has a positive impact on juvenile development. For instance, gaining work experience, such as a one-year internship, can help young individuals discover their academic preferences. Through exposure to various work functions, they can better understand the academic discipline they wish to pursue at university. Moreover, embarking on a long journey to a foreign country before university can provide an opportunity to immerse oneself in a new culture. By interacting with people from diverse nationalities and backgrounds, adolescents can acquire invaluable life experiences that cannot be replicated in a university setting.However, despite these advantages, there are also significant disadvantages to consider. One notable con is the potential delay in graduating from university. Compared to peers who immediately start university after completing high school, those who take a gap year may graduate later, which can have negative implications for their career prospects. In some cultures, such as in Thailand, graduating later than one's peers is believed to hinder a successful career path. Furthermore, critics of this approach argue that working before completing university may not be worthwhile, as most jobs require a strong academic foundation to perform effectively and minimize mistakes. Therefore, it may be more beneficial for young individuals to focus on their university studies rather than gaining work experience beforehand.In conclusion, while having work or travel experiences before starting university can be highly beneficial for young people, providing insight into their desired field of study and exposure to new cultures, it is essential to acknowledge the potential drawbacks. These include delayed university graduation and potentially subpar performance in the workforce. Ultimately, a balanced consideration of both the advantages and disadvantages is necessary to make an informed decision.

question: In some countries, boys and girls are educated separately after the age of about ten years old. Discuss this view and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: In many countries around the world, boys and girls are educated together. There is a group of countries, however, that educate boys and girls separately. This is frequently done on religious grounds, but not always. Having such a system can produce various advantages and disadvantages.One of the principal reasons for educating boys and girls separately is that, if they are together, they can distract each other. After puberty, boys can be strongly attracted to girls and vice versa, and this can result in disruptive conduct in the classroom as, for example, they show off to one another. Separating boys and girls can therefore have the distinct advantage of reducing this disturbing behaviour. However, some teachers have pointed out that this model does not always work, and that separated boys and girls are equally disruptive in class, and sometimes more so. These teachers say that having the opposite sex in the classroom can actually improve behaviour.Many educators also believe that boys and girls have different learning styles and needs. Separating boys and girls can allow teachers to address these needs more easily. There is also a belief that single sex schools allow gender stereotypes to be challenged and therefore education aspirations can be broadened.A major disadvantage of separating boys and girls in education is that the children miss important formative behavioural development when they do not have interaction with the other gender on a regular basis. This can lead to shyness and, more seriously, dysfunctional relationships later in life. Some people also feel that mixed sex schools can promote gender stereotypes rather than reducing them.In conclusion, I feel that children should be educated all together, although I would respect a system in which they are separated due to religious beliefs. My personal opinion is that different genders should learn to interact together from an early age, as this would allow them to develop healthy working relationships with each other.
llm: In numerous countries worldwide, boys and girls receive co-education, learning together in the same classroom. However, there are some nations that adopt a separate education system for boys and girls, often due to religious reasons, but not exclusively. This system of education has its pros and cons. One of the primary arguments in favor of separate education for boys and girls is that it minimizes distractions. As boys and girls enter puberty, they may experience strong attraction towards each other, leading to disruptive behavior in class, such as showing off to one another. Separating them can reduce such disruptions. Nevertheless, some educators argue that separating boys and girls does not necessarily lead to better behavior, and in some cases, may even lead to more disruptions. They suggest that having boys and girls learn together can actually improve their behavior.Many educators believe that boys and girls have different learning styles and needs, and separating them allows teachers to cater to these needs more effectively. Additionally, single-sex schools are thought to challenge traditional gender stereotypes, potentially broadening educational aspirations.On the other hand, a significant drawback of separating boys and girls in education is that it deprives them of crucial formative behavioral development that comes from regular interaction with the opposite gender. This can lead to shyness and, more severely, dysfunctional relationships in the future. Some argue that co-education can actually reinforce gender stereotypes rather than challenging them.In conclusion, I believe that boys and girls should be educated together, although I respect systems that separate them due to religious convictions. In my opinion, boys and girls should learn to interact with each other from a young age, allowing them to develop healthy relationships and work effectively together.

question: In some countries, only few young people go to classical music concerts or or play classical music. Why? Should young people be encouraged to attend and learn more?
human: Classical music is one of the oldest artistic samples of our history. However, the young people of the new generations do not appreciate this kind of music. I believe that governments should encourage young people to learn more about classical music and I will support my stand with valid arguments in the following paragraphs.First of all, the main reason behind the little interest of young people in classical music is the impact of globalization in music and arts. That is because people have the opportunity to know more about multiple things without leaving their homes. However, all this knowledge is only superficial and arts, more specifically classical music, is diminished by the big international industry of music. For instance, reggaeton music, despite the fact that its lyrics are often misogynous, is the most popular style of music these days.Another reason is that children and young people have less interest in cultural matters than in the past because governments do not invest in culture and arts. In most countries, investment in culture has been drastically reduced and young people have no access to classical music concerts and much less a musical instrument that has a huge cost. Consequently, governments should encourage young people to learn more about classical music and the arts.To summarise, this essay has examined the idea of classical music and why young people do not have an interest in this kind of music. As far as I am concerned governments should take responsibility in this matter and invest more money in culture and classical music encouraging young people to learn more about this kind of art.
llm: Classical music is one of the most enduring and historic forms of artistic expression in our cultural heritage. Nevertheless, it appears that younger generations have limited appreciation for this genre. In my opinion, governments have a crucial role to play in fostering an interest in classical music among young people, and I will present compelling arguments to support this stance in the following paragraphs.The primary reason for the lack of interest in classical music among young people is the profound impact of globalization on music and the arts. With the advent of technology, people can now access a vast array of information and cultural content from the comfort of their own homes. However, this exposure is often superficial, and the arts, particularly classical music, are being overshadowed by the massive international music industry. For example, reggaeton music, despite its frequently misogynistic lyrics, has become the most popular genre of music today.Another significant factor contributing to the decline of interest in classical music among young people is the lack of investment in cultural and artistic programs by governments. In many countries, funding for cultural initiatives has been drastically reduced, resulting in limited access to classical music concerts and musical instruments, which are often prohibitively expensive. As a consequence, governments should take initiative to promote classical music and arts among young people.In conclusion, this essay has explored the notion of classical music and the reasons behind its limited appeal to young people. In my view, governments bear a significant responsibility in addressing this issue and should allocate more resources to cultural and classical music programs, thereby encouraging young people to develop an appreciation for this timeless art form.

question: In the modern world, it is possible to shop, work and communicate with people via the Internet and live without any face-to-face contact with others. Is it a positive or negative development?
human: The feasibility of shopping, working and communicating through the Internet is gradually eliminating the necessity of in-person encounters. I believe the merits of this opportunity outnumber its demerits and the lowered volume of traffic in addition to the possibility of long-range communication will be discussed as reasons for this claim in this essay.One chief benefit of using the Internet as a means of making purchases, working and communicating would be the lowered demand for transport, through eradicating the need for face-to-face contact. Such decreased volume of transportation would result in fewer harmful gas emissions which could significantly contribute to creating a cleaner environment. Furthermore, reduced commuting burden yields more free time for individuals. It could be spent in various ways such as working, studying and socialising with family and friends to name a few, which would be more productive and enjoyable.Another key merit of using the Internet would be the emergence of state-of-the-art telecommunication applications. These technologies have made it possible for those with access to the Internet to get in touch and send and receive audiovisual content by pushing just a few buttons. This presents a stark contrast to the situation only a few decades ago, when long-distance communication was possible solely through paper-based letters, which could possibly take months to reach the recipient.There are, however, some drawbacks to online communication, in particular the possibility that the lack of contact brought by technological advancements could potentially weaken human bonds. Taking into consideration that humans are sociable species, this could pose a dire threat to our mental health. This predicament, however, would be mitigated by the extra free time technological developments create for us. This free time could be spent with friends and family and in the long run would strengthen our relationships and improve our emotional wellbeing.To recapitulate, the Internet’s demolishing the need for person-to-person contact brings about numerous benefits. A more sustainable environment as well as more free time generated for individuals, a reduced need to commute in addition to the feasibility of conducting long-distance communication in the easiest way possible, are all instances of the above-mentioned merits.
llm: The rise of online shopping, working, and communication is gradually reducing the need for face-to-face interactions. In my opinion, the advantages of this trend outweigh the disadvantages, and this essay will discuss the benefits of reduced traffic and long-distance communication as evidence to support this claim.One of the primary advantages of using the Internet for transactions, work, and communication is the decreased need for transportation, which is achieved by eliminating the requirement for in-person interactions. This reduction in transportation demand leads to lower emissions of harmful gases, contributing significantly to a cleaner environment. Additionally, the decreased commuting burden provides individuals with more free time, which can be utilized for various activities such as work, study, and socializing with family and friends, making it more productive and enjoyable.Another significant benefit of using the Internet is the emergence of advanced telecommunication technologies. These innovations have enabled people with Internet access to connect and exchange audiovisual content effortlessly. This is a stark contrast to the situation a few decades ago, when long-distance communication was only possible through written letters, which could take months to reach the recipient.However, there are some drawbacks to online communication, particularly the risk that the lack of human contact resulting from technological advancements could potentially weaken interpersonal bonds.
