question: Some people believe that homework should not be given to school children. Others, however, say that homework is an important requirement for children to be able to develop appropriately. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The benefits of giving or not giving homework to children are often debated. Some people feel that children have enough work to do during one day whilst at school, whereas others feel that the more work set, the better.It is true that schools today place more and more demands and pressure on children. The competition to do well, to enter a good university and to get a good job is significant. This has led to the ideology that children should do as much schoolwork as possible in order to help their intellectual development. The argument, however, that more is better is not always valid. There comes a point, especially for a child, when more knowledge cannot be absorbed in a day. When a child has possibly 7 or 8 classes a day on different subjects, he or she is processing a lot of information already. To give more work to be done at home, therefore, would be pointless and even counterproductive. In addition to this, although it is important to be educated, childhood should also be a time when there is an opportunity to just play and enjoy unstructured time. Homework can significantly lessen the possibilities of doing this.On the other hand, it can be argued that there is a place for homework. If study at school is not overdone, the opportunity to look at work again and extend ideas can be an invaluable exercise. It’s easy to forget one thing that has been taught once, but if that concept is revisited a second time, the brain has time to reprocess and likely better understand and remember.It seems to me that there is a place for homework for today’s children. What must be remembered, though, is that homework needs to be limited to age-appropriate parameters, so that a balance can be struck between study and free time and relaxation.
llm: The debate about whether or not to assign homework to children has sparked intense discussion. On one hand, some individuals believe that the school day already provides sufficient workload, while others argue that more assignments lead to better academic outcomes. It is undeniable that modern schools impose significant demands and pressure on children, with the ultimate goal of securing a spot at a prestigious university and landing a well-paying job. This has led to the notion that children should engage in as much academic work as possible to foster intellectual growth. However, the assumption that "more is better" is not always accurate. There is a limit to the amount of information a child can absorb in a day, especially when they have 7 or 8 classes on various subjects. Adding homework to their already packed schedule can be counterproductive and unnecessary. Furthermore, childhood should be a time for play, unstructured activities, and enjoyment, all of which can be hindered by excessive homework. On the other hand, homework can be beneficial when used judiciously. If school study is kept in balance, revisiting concepts at home can be a valuable exercise, allowing the brain to reprocess and solidify understanding. This can help prevent the forgetting of previously taught material and promote better retention. In my opinion, homework has its place in the lives of modern children, but it is crucial to set age-appropriate limits to strike a balance between academic work, free time, and relaxation. This balance is essential to ensure that children can reap the benefits of homework without sacrificing their childhood and overall well-being.

question: Some people believe that preserving natural environment is crucial, but make no effort to do so (reasons and solutions)
human: Some people believe that preserving natural environment is crucial, however, most make no effort to do so. Why do you think this is happening? What are some simple actions that could help the environment?It is commonly believed that preservation of natural resources is imperative, yet most people seem to exert no effort in doing so. Understanding the causes of this negligent attitude may help with devising some simple measures to safeguard the deteriorating environment.Lack of awareness is probably the foremost reason why the vast majority of individuals appears to be unmindful of the current environmental issues. Normally, people have tendency to downplay abstract problems, or those to happen in the distant future. This is because they are not properly informed of the possible detrimental effects of taking the environment for granted. To illustrate, residents in urban areas often deliberately dump their into the nearby creeks and drainage canals causing them to become clogged. It is only when devastating floods strike, that they come to realize the consequences of their actions.Some basic solutions that could be carried out are extensive awareness through all forms of communication and strict implementation of waste management. In addition to the traditional press, social media is a powerful means of disseminating information regarding the impending disasters and their potential hazards. This is a good way of persuading the public to actively take part in the campaign. Another straightforward solution, and by far the least anyone can do to help save the nature is disposing of garbage thoughtfully. Apart from avoiding throwing trash anywhere, everyone should practice proper segregation of biodegradable, non-biodegradable, and recyclable wastes at all times. These actions, when coordinated by the local governments, can be tremendously successful.In conclusion, while individual awareness is key to maintaining a healthy ecosystem, concerted efforts of governments and are much more effective in achieving such goal.The response is well written, it contains reasons, solutions and fully addresses the task. The ideas aren’t repeated, they are conveyed in a clear and easy to understand manner and organised well with sufficient use of cohesive devices. The vocabulary is varied, sentence structures are complex and instances of incorrect grammar are hardly noticeable. Overall, this essay is likely to achieve Band 8 in IELTS.
llm: Many people acknowledge the importance of preserving the natural environment, yet few take action to protect it. What do you think is the reason behind this disparity? What simple steps can be taken to mitigate environmental degradation?It is widely accepted that preserving natural resources is essential, but most individuals seem to make little effort to do so. Understanding the reasons behind this apathy may help in devising simple measures to safeguard the deteriorating environment.A lack of awareness is likely the primary reason why most people appear to be oblivious to current environmental issues. Typically, individuals tend to downplay abstract problems or those that occur in the distant future, as they are not adequately informed about the potential detrimental effects of neglecting the environment. For instance, urban residents often deliberately dump waste into nearby waterways, causing them to become clogged. It is only when devastating floods occur that they realize the consequences of their actions.Some basic solutions that can be implemented include raising awareness through various forms of communication and enforcing strict waste management protocols. In addition to traditional media, social media is a potent tool for disseminating information about impending environmental disasters and their potential hazards, thereby persuading the public to actively participate in conservation efforts. Another straightforward solution, and the least that anyone can do to help preserve the environment, is disposing of garbage thoughtfully. This entails avoiding littering and practicing proper segregation of biodegradable, non-biodegradable, and recyclable wastes at all times. When coordinated by local governments, these actions can be highly effective.In conclusion, while individual awareness is crucial for maintaining a healthy ecosystem, concerted efforts by governments and individuals are far more effective in achieving this goal.

question: Some people believe that the best way to solve environmental problems is to increase the price of fuel.Do you agree or disagree?
human: Raising the price of car fuel is believed by some people to be an excellent method to solve the growing number of environmental issues. However, I strongly disagree with this idea, as doing so would make life difficult for lower-income households. While making fuel more expensive wouldn’t change the habits of wealthy families, switching to fossil fuel alternatives could prove to be much more beneficial for the environment.The most compelling reason against raising the cost of fuel is that the upper classes of society will hardly be affected by rising fuel costs, as this only makes up a minor proportion of their expenditure. They will continue to use their personal vehicles as they wish without a thought for the environment or the higher fuel prices, even if their country has state-of-the-art public transportation.Those who will feel the crunch of this decision are the middle-class and lower-income households, since travelling is a major part of most people’s routine, be it to work, school or shopping. Driving is almost unavoidable in many instances; therefore, raising the price of petrol would only serve to widen the gap between the rich and poor, and serve as an inadvertent form of discrimination.Another reason why increasing the cost of fuel is far from the best way to deal with environmental pollution is that now there are much more viable alternatives. Due to the rapid advances in technology, scientists and engineers have been able to develop several alternatives to fossil fuel, such as cars powered by electricity or naturally produced biofuel. The move to adopt clean energy sources instead of fossil fuels is a much more promising alternative compared to simply making fuel more expensive.In conclusion, I believe that governments of the world should invest more time and money in finding alternatives to fossil fuels that are more environmentally friendly, rather than simply raising the cost of petrol.
llm: Some individuals propose that increasing the cost of car fuel is an effective solution to address the escalating environmental concerns. However, I firmly oppose this notion, as it would disproportionately burden lower-income households. Raising fuel prices would not alter the behavior of affluent families, who would continue to use their vehicles without concern for the environment or the increased costs, even in areas with advanced public transportation systems. In contrast, switching to alternative energy sources could have a more significant positive impact on the environment.The primary argument against hiking fuel costs is that it would have a negligible effect on the wealthy, as fuel expenses constitute a minor portion of their overall expenditure. On the other hand, middle-class and lower-income households would be severely impacted, as commuting is a crucial aspect of daily life, including traveling to work, school, or stores. Driving is often unavoidable, and increasing fuel prices would only serve to exacerbate the socioeconomic divide and inadvertently discriminate against those who are already economically disadvantaged.Furthermore, with the rapid advancements in technology, there are now more viable and environmentally friendly alternatives to fossil fuels. Scientists and engineers have developed innovative options, such as electric cars and biofuels produced from natural sources. Adopting clean energy sources is a more promising strategy than simply increasing fuel prices. In conclusion, I firmly believe that governments should focus their efforts and resources on developing and implementing alternatives to fossil fuels that are more environmentally sustainable, rather than relying on price hikes as a solution to environmental pollution. This approach would be more effective in mitigating the negative impact of fossil fuels on the environment, while also being more equitable and considerate of the economic realities faced by lower-income households.

question: Some people believe that we cannot learn anything from the past for our life today, while others believe that history is a valuable source of information to understand human's life.Discuss both views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is true that these days people say there is little we can gain from previous history, whereas others think that history is a key source to understand our lives. Although there are some strong arguments against learning history, I agree with learning history to know life of human.There are two reasons why people think there is nothing to gain from history. Firstly, there is evidence to support the idea that learning history stresses people out. Based on a survey conducted by Standford University, 57 percent of people consider learning past life of humans a primary source of stress, while less than 6 percent of people said studying previous humans' life was not a stressor. Secondly, people may not have time to remember historical events because the constant stimulation and hustle and bustle of society is holding them back from their life. In turn, they are more likely to regard learning history as useless.Despite the negative drawbacks, I support that historical event is great information to comprehend human's life. The main benefit of a historical event is that it can have a positive impact on people, especially children, as they grow up. Since history has more connection and support to our lives, it allows children to become more insightful and knowledgeable and discover advanced perspectives. For example, I have been widening my perspective through historical events in my family or country because gaining history regarding my family and nation taught me the right attitude to understand today. However, if I did not know any history, I would not have had an opportunity to understand human life and self-development. So, learning history should be encouraged.In conclusion, while I recognize the possible disadvantages of learning history, I believe that the benefits of gaining past events far outweigh them in the long term.
llm: The value of learning from history has become a topic of debate in recent times. Some people argue that history has little to offer in terms of useful knowledge, while others believe it is essential for understanding our lives. Although there are valid arguments against studying history, I firmly believe that it is crucial for gaining insight into human life.There are two primary reasons why some individuals think that history has no practical value. Firstly, research suggests that learning about historical events can be a significant source of stress. A survey conducted by Stanford University found that 57% of respondents considered learning about the past to be a major stressor, whereas less than 6% reported that it was not a source of stress. Secondly, the fast pace of modern society, with its constant distractions and demands, can make it difficult for people to find the time to learn about historical events, leading them to view history as unnecessary.Despite these drawbacks, I strongly advocate for the importance of learning from historical events. One of the main advantages of studying history is its potential to positively impact individuals, particularly children, as they develop and grow. History provides a deeper understanding of our lives, allowing children to become more informed, insightful, and nuanced in their perspectives. For instance, my own understanding of historical events related to my family and country has broadened my perspective and taught me valuable lessons about the right attitude towards life. Without this knowledge, I would have missed out on the opportunity to understand human life and personal development. Therefore, learning history should be actively promoted.In conclusion, while acknowledging the potential downsides of learning history, I am convinced that the long-term benefits of acquiring knowledge about past events far exceed the drawbacks. History is a rich source of information that can empower us with the insight and understanding necessary to navigate our lives effectively.

question: Some people believe that women should be treated as equal to men when applying for a job with the police or the military, while others disagree (opinion)
human: Some people believe that women should be treated as equal to men when applying for a job with the police or the military. Others think that women are less suitable for this kind of job. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Sample EssayIn recent years gender equality in employment has been the topic of heated debate. While some may argue that women are less suited for certain jobs such as with the police or the military, I believe that female candidates should be treated the same as their male counterparts.Those who consider women to be unsuited for some kinds of jobs including the police or the military often hold that opinion because such jobs are extremely physically demanding. As the female body has smaller muscles and less physical strength compared to male body, women may have difficulty engaging in strenuous activity which can be exhausting even for men. In military service, female soldiers are more likely to struggle while defending themselves than their male peers when they are forced to move around carrying heavy firearms in the battle, which can increase their risk of mission failure. Because of the hazards and extreme conditions they may encounter, some people advocate that women are not suitable for work in these fields.Nevertheless, I believe that female applicants should be considered for police or military placements without a gender bias, because women are more suited to certain tasks. In the police service, female officers can perform important roles on some occasions such as a body search where male officers are restricted from touching female convicts. In the military service, female nursing staff are more likely to care better for injured soldiers since maternal instinct makes them dedicated and heart-warming professionals. Furthermore, for the sake of fairness to all, job seekers should have an equal opportunity to choose their jobs freely, regardless of gender. Many women have the desire to work in the police and the military and some of them have relevant expertise and qualifications. Therefore, they should not be discriminated against in employment opportunities for these jobs.In conclusion, although some say that women are incompatible with police and military duties because of the high physical demands, I believe that they should be treated as equal to men. This is because there are certain roles with the police and the military that are more suitable for women than men, and therefore both genders should have equal employment opportunities.
llm: The notion that women should be treated equally to men when applying for positions in the police force or the military is a contentious issue. On one hand, some individuals argue that women are less suited for these roles due to the physically demanding nature of the jobs. On the other hand, others believe that female candidates should be given equal consideration as their male counterparts. In this essay, both perspectives will be discussed, and a personal viewpoint will be presented.The argument that women are not suitable for certain jobs, such as those in the police or military, often stems from the belief that these professions require a high level of physical strength and endurance. Proponents of this view point out that the female body, with its smaller muscles and lower physical strength compared to the male body, may struggle with the strenuous activities often required in these fields. For instance, in military combat situations, female soldiers might face greater challenges in defending themselves while carrying heavy firearms, potentially increasing the risk of mission failure. Due to the hazardous conditions and extreme environments associated with these jobs, some advocate for the exclusion of women from these roles.However, it is essential to consider that female applicants bring unique strengths and abilities to the table, making them highly suited for certain tasks within the police and military services. For example, in police work, female officers are often better positioned to handle situations such as body searches of female suspects, where male officers may be restricted due to privacy concerns. Similarly, in military settings, female nursing staff often provide superior care to injured soldiers, leveraging their nurturing instincts to deliver dedicated and compassionate service. Moreover, the principle of fairness dictates that job seekers should have equal opportunities to choose their careers without gender bias. Many women possess the desire, relevant expertise, and qualifications to excel in the police and military, and thus, they should not face discrimination in employment opportunities for these roles.In conclusion, although the physically demanding nature of police and military jobs may lead some to believe that women are less compatible with these duties, it is crucial to recognize the valuable contributions women can make in these fields. Given the specific roles within the police and military that are more suited to women's skills and strengths, and the importance of equal employment opportunities, it is reasonable to treat female candidates with the same consideration as their male counterparts. Ultimately, embracing gender equality in these professions not only aligns with the principles of fairness and equality but also enriches these services with a diverse range of skills and perspectives.

question: Some people claim that it is acceptable to use animals in medical research (discuss)
human: Some people claim that it is acceptable to use animals in medical research for the benefit of human beings, while others argue that it is wrong. Discuss both views and give your opinion.People have different views on how medical research should be conducted and tested. Although many people support the use of for developing medicines, I personally believe that animal testing is morally wrong.The main reason why some people value to conduct medical research is because animal testing has contributed to many life-saving cures and treatments. It is true that nearly every medical breakthrough in the last 100 years has resulted directly from research using animals. For example, experiments in which dogs had their pancreases removed led directly to the discovery of insulin, critical to saving the lives of diabetics. Furthermore, it is impossible to release to the market before proving it no harm to humans and laboratory mice are appropriate research subjects because they are similar to human beings in many ways.However, I people who consider medical development that involved the use of animals cruel and unacceptable. I believe that the lives of all creatures should be respected and we, humans, have no right to for our own benefits. Governments should invest in developing alternative methods that can replace when doing medical research. For example, a software program can be developed to model a human immune system and new drugs can be tested on the software rather than animals. In this way, no animals will suffer from the medical tests and the society can still benefit from medical development.In conclusion, although it is undoubtedly true that animal testing has helped scientists in drug developments and medical discoveries, I believe that the benefits to humans do not justify the suffering caused to animals and we should use alternative methods when doing medical research that do not involve animals suffering.This is a great essay. It addresses the two sides of the argument by exploring reasons why animals should and should not be used in medical research. The ideas are well explained and supported by examples. The use of paragraphing is efficient and helps with logical sequencing of ideas. Linking words are used appropriately to achieve the necessary cohesion. Author’s meaning is skillfully conveyed by the use of wide range of vocabulary. Even though there are some inaccurately used expressions, they don’t hinder understanding. Most sentences are error-free, instances of faulty grammar are rare. Overall, this essay seems worthy of IELTS Band 8.
llm: The debate on whether animals should be used in medical research for the benefit of human beings is a contentious issue, with some people advocating for its acceptance and others vehemently opposing it. This essay aims to discuss both perspectives and provide an opinion on the matter.On one hand, proponents of animal testing in medical research argue that it is a necessary evil, given the significant contributions it has made to the development of life-saving medicines and treatments. Over the past century, nearly every major medical breakthrough has been a direct result of research conducted on animals. For instance, experiments involving dogs that had their pancreases removed led to the discovery of insulin, a crucial hormone for saving the lives of diabetics. Moreover, before any drug can be released to the market, it must be proven safe for human consumption, and laboratory mice, due to their biological similarities to humans, serve as suitable test subjects.On the other hand, there are those who consider the use of animals in medical development to be cruel and unacceptable. This perspective is rooted in the belief that all living beings' lives should be respected, and humans have no inherent right to exploit animals for their own benefits. Instead, governments should invest in developing alternative research methods that can replace animal testing. For example, software programs can be designed to simulate the human immune system, allowing new drugs to be tested virtually rather than on living creatures. This approach would eradicate animal suffering from medical tests while still enabling society to reap the benefits of medical advancements.In conclusion, while it is undeniable that animal testing has played a pivotal role in drug development and medical discoveries, the suffering it inflicts on animals cannot be justified by the benefits it provides to humans. Therefore, alternative methods that do not involve animal suffering should be employed in medical research. This stance is based on the ethical consideration that the lives of all creatures should be treated with respect and dignity, and that human innovation should strive to find compassionate solutions that benefit both humans and animals alike.This essay effectively presents a balanced view of the argument, exploring reasons both for and against the use of animals in medical research. The ideas are clearly articulated and supported with relevant examples, demonstrating a thoughtful and informed perspective on the issue. The use of paragraphs enhances the logical flow of ideas, and linking words contribute to the essay's cohesion. The author's message is conveyed through a varied and adept use of vocabulary, making the essay engaging and persuasive. While minor inaccuracies in expression are present, they do not detract from the overall understanding of the text. Most sentences are grammatically correct,

question: Some people feel that entertainers such as film stars, pop musicians or sports stars are paid too much money.Do you agree or disagree?Which other types of job should be highly paid?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: Jobs such as actors, musicians or athlete earns a lot of money, however, a part of people argued that these kinds of people are overpaid. In my opinion, I disagree with this view and believes that they deserved the high salary.People who works as a movie stars, musicians and sports player deserved high money paid. This is because they advocated all there time and effort to get the salary that they have today. Before they become famous, they only have few incomes or even get nothing. That is to say, many musicians did not get any payment at the begining of their career, so do the actors and sports players, they spent their time but do not get any money. For instance, before being a well-known musicians, they have to spend their own money on buying equipment to produce musics or to public the songs they have made. Also, the creativety and their works cannot be measured by money. Thus, they deserved high salary because of their profession and uncopyable works.Jobs which needs professional skills and the job envolves high risk shoul also be highly paid. Such as doctors and programmers, their job are unplaceable because these envolved professional knowledge that not everyone had. Moreover, people works in high-risk environment deserved high payment too. For example, fire-fighters, they might got hurt or even die while working. Therefore, higher salary is needed for jobs that need special skills and career with high risk.To sum up, I agree with the statement because of the reasons above, and jobs with special knowledge and people works in dangerous environment should also be highly paid.
llm: Certain professions, such as acting, music, and athletics, are often associated with high salaries. However, some people argue that individuals in these fields are overpaid. I disagree with this perspective and believe that they deserve their lucrative compensation.Professionals like movie stars, musicians, and athletes earn high salaries because they have dedicated tremendous time and effort to achieve their current status. Before gaining fame, many of these individuals had limited or no income. For instance, budding musicians often spend their own money on equipment and promotional materials to produce and share their music. Similarly, actors and athletes invest significant time and resources into their craft without immediate financial reward. The creativity and uniqueness of their work cannot be measured solely by monetary value. Therefore, their high salaries are justified by the value they bring to their profession and the originality of their work.Furthermore, jobs that require specialized skills and involve high risks should also be highly compensated. Professions like doctors and programmers possess expertise that not everyone possesses, making their work invaluable. Additionally, individuals who work in high-risk environments, such as firefighters, deserve higher pay due to the dangers they face on the job. The risk of injury or death is a significant factor that warrants higher salaries for these brave individuals.In conclusion, I firmly believe that certain professions, particularly those requiring specialized knowledge and involving high risks, warrant high salaries. The value, effort, and risks associated with these jobs justify the compensation they receive, and I agree that these individuals deserve to be well-paid for their work.

question: Some people feel that fashion is like art and a significant part of society, while others feel that fashion is a waste of time and money.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The fashion industry today is an important component of society and people’s lives. It is true that many people care little for clothes and scorn the importance that others attach to them; however, this does not mean that the significance that people give to fashion is a waste of time and money.When one considers that areas of the world suffer from poverty, disease and inadequate access to food and clean water, the emphasis attached to fashion by the developed world can seem out of proportion. Many people would contend that the resources put into developing and creating fashion would be more ethically spent on creating some level of equality in terms of the right to live a healthy and happy life. This point is hard to argue with. However, it is also true that people in the developed world cannot be expected to send all their spending money to people in need and that wanting to look good is an unalterable human trait.The fashion industry contributes to the society much like most other industries. It provides jobs and income to millions of people around the world and the money that changes hands generates taxes that contribute to the fabric of society. There is more to fashion than trying to look better than others and excessive luxury. The high level of fashion is indeed a kind of art form and, like other art forms, there will always be people who appreciate it, want to create it and want to spend money on it. It is part of the development of civilisation and this is not likely to change.I therefore feel that, although the gap between the rich and the poor sometimes makes it seem that fashion is a waste of time and money and an unethical use of resources, fashion is an important part of today’s society and economic output. This leads me to believe that trying to strike a balance between selfish greed and a more altruistic way of living should be an individual choice.
llm: The fashion industry is a significant aspect of modern society, playing a substantial role in people's lives. While some individuals may not prioritize clothing or view the emphasis on fashion as excessive, this does not necessarily mean that the importance attached to fashion is frivolous or a waste of resources. It is understandable that, given the existence of poverty, disease, and inadequate access to basic necessities like food and clean water in certain parts of the world, the attention and resources devoted to fashion in the developed world may seem disproportionate. Many argue that the funds invested in fashion could be better spent on addressing global inequalities and ensuring that everyone has the right to a healthy and happy life - a viewpoint that is difficult to dispute. However, it is also reasonable to acknowledge that individuals in the developed world cannot be expected to allocate all their discretionary income towards charity, as the desire to present oneself well is an inherent human trait.The fashion industry, like many others, contributes significantly to society. It is a source of employment and income for millions globally, and the economic activity it generates contributes to the societal fabric through taxation. Fashion encompasses more than mere competition for appearance or luxury; high-end fashion can be considered an art form, appreciated and supported by those who value it. As with other art forms, there will always be individuals who wish to create, appreciate, and invest in it. This aspect of human expression and creativity is an integral part of civilization's evolution, and it is unlikely to diminish.In conclusion, although the disparity between the rich and the poor may lead some to view fashion as an unnecessary indulgence and an unethical allocation of resources, I believe that fashion remains a vital component of contemporary society and economic activity. This perspective leads me to the conclusion that finding a balance between personal indulgence and altruism should be a matter of individual choice, allowing people to navigate their own path between contributing to the greater good and participating in the aspects of society, like fashion, that bring them personal fulfillment and expression.

question: Some people feel that learning a foreign language is an essential component of a child’s education. Others feel that learning a foreign language is often a waste of time that can be better spent on learning about technology and other more vocational subjects.Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: Throughout the history of education, learning a foreign language or languages has been a constant component. Of course, many people feel that this is really an unnecessary part of education for everyone, but this is not a point of view that I share.The opponents to learning a foreign language might argue that most people do not travel that often outside their own country. In addition to this, out of all the countries of the world, comparatively not many share the same language. Therefore, learning a foreign language will only be useful for the very limited time that one spends in a country where this language is used. For some people, the language might never be used in their entire lives. When one thinks about how much time and money are spent training language teachers, buying resources, going on trips and delivering lessons for such a negligible benefit, this would seem to be a very inefficient allocation of resources.However, the benefits of learning a foreign language go further than just the ability to use it from time to time on a holiday or business trip. Firstly, through learning one language, one gains an understanding to some extent of how all languages work. Thus, no matter where people might end up around the world, the knowledge of language can be of use. Secondly, with the study of a foreign language, one also opens oneself up to other cultures. This allows in turn an appreciation for different points of view and belief systems. With an ever-shrinking world due to globalisation, the ability to empathise and understand the people from other countries is vital to reducing conflict and creating a more tolerant society. Finally, quite simply learning languages is excellent for the improvement of general cognitive skills.It seems to me that learning a foreign language, therefore, is more than just gaining the ability to speak a few words of a foreign tongue. It is part of intellectual and social development and needs to be continued for everyone in today’s schools.
llm: Throughout the history of education, foreign language learning has been a consistent element. While some people believe that this is an unnecessary aspect of education, I disagree. Critics of foreign language learning might argue that most people rarely travel outside their own country and that the languages spoken in other countries are not widely shared. As a result, they claim that learning a foreign language is only useful for the brief period spent in a country where that language is spoken, and for some, it may never be used at all. They point out that the time, money, and resources spent on language instruction, materials, and travel seem like a wasteful allocation of resources, given the limited benefits.However, the advantages of learning a foreign language extend far beyond the occasional use on vacation or business trips. Firstly, acquiring one language provides insight into the workings of all languages, making it a valuable tool regardless of where one travels. Secondly, studying a foreign language exposes individuals to new cultures, fostering appreciation for diverse perspectives and belief systems. In an increasingly globalized world, the ability to understand and empathize with people from other countries is crucial for reducing conflict and promoting tolerance. Lastly, learning languages has been shown to improve general cognitive skills.In my opinion, learning a foreign language is not just about acquiring a few words of a foreign language, but rather it is an essential part of intellectual and social development. As such, it should continue to be a part of every student's education in today's schools. The benefits of foreign language learning far outweigh the costs, and its importance cannot be overstated in an interconnected world.

question: Some people feel that the design of newly constructed buildings in big cities should be controlled by governments. Others believe those who finance the construction of a building should be free to design it as they see fit.Discuss both these views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is often argued that governments should involve in construction's design in huge cities, while others argued that governments do not have to retrict the free of designers' imagination if those designs are splendid fit on the cities. I believe that if that were to happen, it would be the positive development. This essay will highlight the both views and give personal opinion from the former argument's side.To begin with latter opinion, although governments have worried about the combination of buildings entirely, the strong limitation about design can cause squandering of designers' skills. There are huge number of competitions about designing building in this society, and the evolution in these fields has developed dramatically. However, if there is a strict criteria on design of building, the majority of intelligences do not need to hammer away to come up with revolutional outline for building.On the other hand, signitured design of the big cities by itself can be the purpose of trevelling as a landmark, and it can be followed by significant economical achievement in the country. To take myself as an example, in 2017, I went to Gold Coast for study automotive engineering, and I was stunnied becaused of the atmosphere which is formed by combination of similar buildings and beach. Furthermore, according to the research from Sydney university, Gold Coast is one of the cities which make a fortune because of marvelous view.To sum up with, I would therefore argue that in spite of the fact that building design restriction can influence on architects negatively, it has a potential ability to make a significant profit in the future.
llm: The role of government in regulating building design in large cities is a topic of ongoing debate. Some argue that governments should exert control over design to ensure cohesion and harmony in urban landscapes, while others believe that such intervention would stifle the creativity and imagination of designers, potentially hindering innovation. I firmly believe that government involvement in design regulation could lead to positive outcomes. This essay aims to present both perspectives and argue in favor of government regulation, based on the potential benefits it could bring.On one hand, proponents of minimal government interference in design argue that strict regulations could lead to underutilization of designers' talents. The design and architecture fields are highly competitive, with numerous competitions driving innovation and significant advancements. However, rigid design criteria could deter talented individuals from striving for groundbreaking designs, as their creativity would be constrained by predetermined guidelines.On the other hand, distinctive and well-planned urban design can serve as a major tourist attraction and a symbol of a city's identity, potentially leading to substantial economic gains. For instance, during my visit to the Gold Coast in 2017 for automotive engineering studies, I was impressed by the aesthetic harmony created by the combination of architectural styles and natural beauty. Research from the University of Sydney highlights the Gold Coast as an example of a city that benefits financially from its visually appealing landscape.In conclusion, despite the potential negative impact of design restrictions on architects, I argue that such regulations possess the potential to yield significant economic benefits in the long run. By guiding urban design, governments can contribute to creating unique and appealing cityscapes that attract tourism and boost local economies, outweighing the potential drawbacks on designer creativity.

question: Some people feel that with the rise of artificial intelligence, computers and robots will take over the roles of teachers. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: With ever increasing technological advances, computers and robots are replacing human roles in different areas of society. This trend can also be seen in education, where interactive programs can enhance the educational experience for children and young adults. Whether, however, this revolution can also take over the role of the teacher completely is debatable, and I oppose this idea as it is unlikely to serve students well.The roles of computers and robots can be seen in many areas of the workplace. Classic examples are car factories, where a lot of the repetitive precision jobs done on assembly lines have been performed by robots for many years, and medicine, where diagnosis, and treatment, including operations, have also been assisted by computers for a long time. According to the media, it won’t also be long until we have cars that are driven automatically.It has long been discussed whether robots and computers can do this in education. It is well known that the complexity of programs can now adapt to so many situations that something can already be set up that has the required knowledge of the teacher, along with the ability to predict and answer all questions that might be asked by students. In fact, due to the nature of computers, the knowledge levels can far exceed a teacher’s and have more breadth, as a computer can have equal knowledge in all the subjects that are taught in school, as opposed to a single teacher’s specialisation. It seems very likely, therefore, that computers and robots should be able to deliver the lessons that teachers can, including various ways of differentiating and presenting materials to suit varying abilities and ages of students.Where I am not convinced is in the pastoral role of teachers. Part of teaching is managing behaviour and showing empathy with students, so that they feel cared for and important. Even if a robot or computer can be programmed to imitate these actions, students will likely respond in a different way when they know an interaction is part of an algorithm rather than based on human emotion.Therefore, although I feel that computers should be able to perform a lot of the roles of teachers in the future, they should be used as educational tools to assist teachers and not to replace them. In this way, students would receive the benefits of both ways of instruction.
llm: As technology continues to advance at an unprecedented rate, computers and robots are increasingly assuming roles traditionally held by humans in various sectors of society. This phenomenon is also observable in the education sector, where interactive programs have the potential to enhance the learning experience for children and young adults. However, the notion that this technological revolution could completely supplant the role of teachers is a topic of debate, and one that I disagree with, as I believe it would not serve the best interests of students.The integration of computers and robots into the workforce is a trend that has been evident for some time. Classic examples include automobile manufacturing, where robots have long been used to perform repetitive and precise tasks on assembly lines, and the medical field, where computers have been employed to assist with diagnoses, treatments, and even surgical operations. According to media reports, it is anticipated that we will soon have vehicles capable of driving themselves autonomously.The question of whether computers and robots can assume educational roles has been a subject of discussion for a considerable period. It is widely acknowledged that the complexity of computer programs has reached a level where they can be tailored to adapt to a multitude of situations, thereby potentially replicating the knowledge and predictive capabilities of a teacher, including the ability to answer questions posed by students. Furthermore, due to the inherent nature of computers, their knowledge base can far surpass that of a human teacher, both in depth and breadth, as they can possess equivalent knowledge across all subjects taught in schools, unlike human teachers who specialize in specific areas. It thus appears highly plausible that computers and robots could deliver lessons in a manner comparable to, if not surpassing, that of human teachers, including adapting instructional materials to cater to diverse student abilities and ages.My skepticism lies in the realm of the pastoral aspects of teaching. A significant component of a teacher's role involves managing student behavior and displaying empathy, thereby making students feel valued and cared for. Even if a robot or computer could be programmed to mimic these actions, students are likely to respond differently when they are aware that an interaction is predetermined by an algorithm rather than being a genuine expression of human emotion.In conclusion, while I believe that computers and robots will undoubtedly be capable of performing many of the functions of teachers in the future, I advocate for their use as supplementary educational tools to support teachers, rather than as replacements. This approach would enable students to benefit from both the technological and human aspects of instruction, thereby enriching their educational experience.

question: Some people like to own the place where they live, but other people like to rent where they live. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250 words.
human: The debate over whether it is better to own or rent the property in which one lives is one that has strong supporters on each side. There are persuasive arguments for both points of view.One of the main advantages of renting a property is flexibility. Usually, a tenant only has to give a month’s notice before changing where he or she lives. If a property is owned and a change is needed, the property must be put onto the market and it is frequently a long and stressful process to get a sale completed. Sometimes, the wrong time of year or a bad market can mean that a sale is not possible. Another advantage of renting is that a large amount of a family’s capital is not tied up in the property. Property can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars and often a lot more. If one rents, this money can be spent on other things to help improve the family’s quality of life. If the property is on a mortgage, then the deposit, also often very large, is tied up in the property and the pressure of having to make substantial payments every month can cause a lot of stress.Owning a property does have various advantages, though. Even though people usually have to service a mortgage every month with payments, this money is then built up with the property. With renting, the money is lost to the landlord, but at the end of the term of the mortgage, the whole property is owned by the family. This makes the process of living in a property a type of investment. In addition, the property’s value often goes up after time, frequently creating a substantial profit. Owning the property where one lives can also create a sense of well-being and self-actualisation.The decision to whether one rents or owns the property in which one lives really boils down to individual preference. My opinion is that it is much more preferable to own a property, mainly because it creates a valuable asset for the family.
llm: The age-old debate about whether it's better to own or rent a home has sparked intense discussion, with passionate advocates on both sides presenting compelling arguments. On the one hand, renting offers a significant advantage: flexibility. Typically, tenants are only required to provide a month's notice before relocating, allowing them to adapt quickly to changing circumstances. In contrast, selling a property can be a lengthy and stressful process, especially if the timing is unfavorable or the market is slow. Moreover, renting frees up a substantial amount of capital that would otherwise be tied up in a property, which can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars. This capital can then be utilized to enhance the family's overall quality of life. Additionally, the burden of a mortgage and the associated monthly payments can be a significant source of stress.On the other hand, owning a property has its own set of benefits. Although monthly mortgage payments can be a financial strain, the money invested in the property ultimately translates into ownership. In contrast to renting, where payments are essentially lost to the landlord, owning a property allows families to build equity over time. Once the mortgage is fully paid off, the property is entirely owned by the family, making the investment a valuable asset. Furthermore, property values often appreciate over time, resulting in a substantial profit. Homeownership can also foster a sense of security and self-fulfillment.Ultimately, the decision to rent or own a property depends on individual preferences and priorities. In my opinion, owning a property is the more desirable option, primarily because it allows families to accumulate a valuable asset. However, it's essential to weigh the pros and cons carefully and consider what works best for each unique situation.

question: Some people prefer to spend their lives doing the same things and avoiding changes. Others, however think that change is always a good thing. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
human: Nowadays, people are arguing whether an ideal lifestyle should be a stable one or should it include a wide ranges of changes.In my opinion, whether changes are needed should be determined the of you are at.Apparently, are favorable the development of young people, in to their careers. Primarily, an abundant experience in varieties of jobs enables the young to master a broad range of techniques and skills, leading to significant edge over counterparts in the competition for employment. Meanwhile, trying various roles in life and work provides wide of lifestyles for the young in the future. Only after this comparison can they realize what the real goals of their .However, other than frequent changes, the elderly who have undergone all these challenges may pursue a steady lifestyle. For the elders, concentration on their favorite activities would give rise to a sense of enjoyment and security, which is helpful to physical and psychological health. Due to a stable life, the elderly are less exposed to stress, leading to a decrease in adrenal hormones and resulting in their well-.Furthermore, degeneration of mental and physical function would make the elderly unlikely to adapt to external changes, causing and , which are not contributing to their health.Above all, it is unlikely to describe the changes in life with a positive or negative term. Accommodation for personal needs and goals is more important than the changes themselves.
llm: The ideal lifestyle has become a topic of debate, with some arguing that it should be stable and others believing it should encompass a wide range of changes. In my opinion, the need for change depends on the stage of life one is in. For young people, changes are beneficial for their development and careers. Having a diverse range of job experiences allows them to acquire a broad spectrum of techniques and skills, giving them a significant advantage over their peers in the job market. Additionally, exploring various roles in life and work exposes them to different lifestyles, enabling them to compare and discover their true goals. On the other hand, after having navigated through life's challenges, older adults may prefer a more stable lifestyle. For seniors, focusing on their favorite activities fosters a sense of enjoyment and security, which is beneficial for both physical and mental health. A stable life also reduces their exposure to stress, leading to lower levels of adrenal hormones and improved overall well-being. Furthermore, the natural decline in mental and physical function with age makes it difficult for the elderly to adapt to external changes, which can be detrimental to their health. Ultimately, it's challenging to categorize changes in life as inherently positive or negative. What matters most is adapting to personal needs and goals, rather than the changes themselves.

human: One the one hand good education is a highly recommended skill in the developed countries, on the other hand of many people in regions of poverty. llm: On one hand, good education is highly valued in developed countries, while on the other hand, it remains an unattainable luxury for many people living in poverty-stricken regions. However, what makes education a crucial factor in a country's development? We must recognize that education is a fundamental necessity for everyone, regardless of their background or socio-economic status. The only difference lies in what we learn. Often, the limited educational opportunities available to poor and less educated individuals are more closely tied to their personal circumstances than to broader issues affecting the country as a whole. In some cases, attending school is a luxury that is simply too expensive, and it does not provide a means of supporting a family.Nonetheless, there must be a compelling reason why education is essential. In my opinion, some countries have come to realize that education is the driving force behind the globalization process. For instance, India's overhaul of its educational system has led to a significant transformation of the country's economy, from a impoverished region to a hub with vast potential for IT expertise.In light of this, it is imperative that we take education seriously and make it accessible to a broad range of people. Investing in education is the key to unlocking a brighter future, with far-reaching effects on the economy and social life. In conclusion, I firmly believe in the importance of education for a country's development. A lack of knowledge inevitably leads to poverty, whereas learning and knowledge are powerful tools that can shape the future. Therefore, it is essential that education be recognized as a top priority and a critical investment in the years to come, making it an official task of utmost importance.

question: Some people say free time activities for children should be organized by parents. Others say that children should be free to choose what they do in their free time. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
human: Whether parents should fully intervene in their children's organization of their leisure time or let them decide it, remains a big discussion. In this essay I will contrast the two opinions and I will explain why I think a good balance is needed.One of the reasons supporting the first view is the idea of the undeveloped children's ability to organize. This is because, although some of them might seem very mature for their age, others might struggle understanding the importance of having a routine, besides playing video games. For instance, many parents orientate their children helping them to organize hobbies and teaching a very important skill, time managment.On the other hand, some people encourage children to decide themselves what to do as this stimulates creativity and personal growth. This view, therefore, opens a new world for the little ones who can decide whatever they like, having multiple options. For example, children in this situation quite often are supported when they want to play sports or participate in a painting class.In my opinion, parents should not only be envolved as much as they can in all aspects of their children's lives, but also they might encourage the little ones to have personal opinions and decision about their hobbies and leisure actitivities. This may be a good way to build trust and communication between parents and children. Moreover, children learn responsability while being guided by their parents.In conclusion, some parents help their children more in scheduling their free time, while others intervene less leaving them to create a routine freely. I believe, parents should always be involved in their children's lives and decisions, allowing children participation too, which brings multiple benefits to their relationship.
llm: The debate about whether parents should fully control their children's leisure time or give them autonomy to make their own decisions remains a contentious issue. This essay will examine both perspectives and argue that a balanced approach is necessary.One argument in favor of parental intervention is that children may not have the necessary skills to organize their leisure time effectively. Although some children may appear mature for their age, others may struggle to understand the importance of establishing a routine beyond playing video games. Many parents take an active role in guiding their children to develop hobbies and teach essential time management skills.On the other hand, some argue that giving children the freedom to decide their own activities fosters creativity and personal growth. This approach opens up a world of possibilities, allowing children to explore multiple options and make choices about their interests. For example, children who are given autonomy may be more likely to participate in sports or enroll in a painting class.In my opinion, parents should strike a balance between being involved in their children's lives and giving them the freedom to make their own decisions about hobbies and leisure activities. By doing so, parents can build trust and communication with their children, while also teaching them responsibility. This approach allows children to develop their own interests and opinions, while still receiving guidance and support from their parents.In conclusion, while some parents take a more hands-on approach to scheduling their children's free time, others give them more independence. I believe that parents should be involved in their children's lives and decisions, while also allowing children to participate and make their own choices, which can have numerous benefits for their relationship and the child's development.

question: Some people say that all popular TV entertainment programmes should aim to educate viewers about important social issues. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?
human: It is often said that all influential TV entertainment programs should be geared towards raising people’s awareness about social issues that matter. While some TV programs could be suitable for this purpose, I disagree with the view that it should be mandatory for all of them, as the decision whether to do so must take into account the nature of the TV content and the channel’s audience.There is a large group of professionals who would benefit from deepening their understanding of what is happening in the world. Stock traders and bankers, for example, must always keep track of numerous business trends on a global scale, and they would appreciate this type of information on their favourite TV shows. Young people are another suitable audience due to the fact that they enjoy learning about popular topics from TV programmes. For instance, SDGs or the Sustainable Development Goals has now become an important topic to learn for children at school. Educational TV would provide a welcome alternative to textbooks, making learning more fun.Despite the potential advantages of incorporating educational content in TV programs, it is important to remember that the purpose of entertainment TV is for people to escape reality, to take a break from their hectic lives. Being reminded about some troubling social issues would not be appreciated by those who just want to unwind after a long day at work. Another consideration is how the content is perceived by the audience, because broadcasting serious topics as part of a comedy show might lead some viewers to believe they are of lesser significance. This would make TV shows of light-hearted nature a poor choice for inclusion of content on pressing social issues.In conclusion, entertainment TV programs can be an effective form of education for some people and a great tool to spread information. However, not all of them should be used for this purpose as there are various ways people appreciate them.
llm: The notion that all influential TV entertainment programs should focus on raising awareness about pressing social issues is a common one. However, I disagree with making this a mandatory requirement for all TV programs, as the decision to do so should depend on the type of content and the target audience. Certain professionals, such as stock traders and bankers, would benefit from in-depth coverage of global trends and issues on their preferred TV shows, as it would help them stay informed about current events. Young people are another suitable audience, as they often enjoy learning about popular topics through TV programs. For instance, educational TV programs could make learning about important topics like the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) more engaging and fun, providing a welcome alternative to traditional textbooks.Nevertheless, it is essential to consider the primary purpose of entertainment TV, which is to provide an escape from reality and a break from the stresses of daily life. Viewers who seek to unwind after a long day may not appreciate being reminded of troubling social issues. Additionally, the audience's perception of the content is crucial, as incorporating serious topics into a comedy show might lead viewers to perceive them as less significant. This suggests that light-hearted TV shows may not be the most suitable platform for discussing pressing social issues.In conclusion, while entertainment TV programs can be an effective means of education and information dissemination for certain audiences, not all programs should be utilized for this purpose. The appreciation and purpose of TV programs vary among viewers, and it is essential to consider these differences when deciding whether to incorporate educational content into a TV show. By doing so, TV programs can effectively cater to diverse audience needs and preferences, providing both entertainment and education.

question: Some people say that arts subjects are as essential as academic ones and should be part of school syllabus (agree/disagree)
human: Some people say that art subjects such as music, drama and creative writing are an essential part of education, and every school should include them in its syllabus. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Give your opinion and examples from your own experience.Art subjects such as music, drama and creative writing are fundamentals that enrich our lives. However, some parents say schools on teaching more academic subjects, such as mathematics, science, literature and history. In my opinion, both academic and arts subjects should be taught and I will expand on the pros and cons of including arts in the school program further on in this essay.On the one hand, academic subjects are often required when we get into higher . Academic subjects may be considered as in the academic world. Personally, I have never taken an entrance exam of art subjects for high school or university. In other words, schools measured my academic abilities using academic subjects, not art subjects. To suit the current educational system, many parents in my home country, Japan, send their children to cram schools to study academic subjects deeply.On the other hand, art subjects can strengthen the creativity and flexibility of individuals. Liberal arts, which include cultural understanding and knowledge, also include other arts subjects. In addition, we are living in the era of automation and artificial intelligence which are replacing human labor and office work more and more. In this regard, human creativity becomes more important. Therefore, art subjects are being more in demand to make a difference between individuals and computers.In conclusion, academic and arts subjects should blend in a school syllabus in a balanced way. Art subjects can also a better personality in individuals, so participation in these classes should be encouraged as well as academic achievements.The writer explored the reasons why including arts subjects in school syllabus is a good idea, while fluently expressing ideas and supporting them by examples. Correct paragraphing assists with orderly presentation of information, making this essay easy to follow; the range of vocabulary is quite wide. Accuracy of expression needs a bit more attention (see corrections underlined in blue), but overall, this essay could achieve IELTS Band 8.
llm: The importance of art subjects, such as music, drama, and creative writing, in education has sparked a debate. While some argue that these subjects are essential and should be included in every school's curriculum, others believe that academic subjects like mathematics, science, literature, and history should take precedence. In my opinion, a balance between academic and art subjects is crucial, and I will discuss the pros and cons of incorporating art subjects into the school program.On the one hand, academic subjects are often a requirement for higher education and are considered fundamental in the academic world. From my personal experience, I have never been required to take an entrance exam for art subjects to attend high school or university. Instead, my academic abilities were assessed through academic subjects. To adapt to the current educational system, many parents in my home country, Japan, enroll their children in cram schools to focus on in-depth study of academic subjects.On the other hand, art subjects have the power to enhance an individual's creativity and flexibility. Liberal arts, which encompass cultural understanding and knowledge, also include other art subjects. Moreover, we are living in an era where automation and artificial intelligence are increasingly replacing human labor and office work. In this context, human creativity becomes a vital differentiator between individuals and computers. Consequently, the demand for art subjects is on the rise, as they enable individuals to stand out from the crowd.In conclusion, I firmly believe that academic and art subjects should be balanced within a school's curriculum. Art subjects not only foster a more well-rounded personality in individuals but also encourage participation and creativity, alongside academic achievements. By incorporating art subjects into the syllabus, schools can provide students with a more comprehensive education that prepares them for an ever-changing world.

question: Some people say that modern technology has made shopping today easier, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your opinion
human: It is commonly argued that the fast pacing technology has helped people do shopping at the present time more easily. However, some people think online shopping is really difficult for them. This essay will consider both the advantages and disadvantages of the use of technology for shopping.One disadvantage of online shopping can be mentioned is that people cannot familiarize themselves with online applications for ordering essential goods and food. In fact, the elderly are not good at technology enough to go to virtual supermarkets. Besides, those who live in remote areas are not accessible easily to technology to buy online groceries.Despite its disadvantage, online shopping has brought about advantages for those who are technology natives. Firstly, it can be time-saving. In fact, shoppers can order any things they need with some clicks on the items, payment method, and time of delivery. Especially in a lingering Covid-19, when social distancing measures have been effective in some places in Viet Nam, according to a survey, the number of online shoppers has been increasing day by day, and thus many applications have been into existence, developed, and thrived.Another advantage of virtual shopping is that it can be life-saving to many people in a pandemic across nations. Going to supermarkets can be detrimental to buyers due to the spread of viruses and the higher risk of infection. For example, in order to buy bread for breakfast, people have to go out for it and thus may be exposed to infectious or incubated victims of Covid-19. Moreover, with preventive measures of Covid-19 containment, such as people not being allowed to go out for their essential goods, if they do not know how to make an online order, it is really difficult for them to survive during a pandemic.In conclusion, the use of technology for virtual shopping is beneficial to our time-saving and life-saving matters, though it is not familiar to some people. In my opinion, thanks to its advantages, I will continue to go shopping online, though the world has gone through the Covid-19 pandemic successfully.
llm: The advent of rapid technological advancements has made shopping easier for many people in today's world. However, some individuals find online shopping to be a daunting task. This essay aims to explore both the benefits and drawbacks of utilizing technology for shopping purposes.One notable disadvantage of online shopping is the difficulty some people face in navigating online applications to purchase essential goods and groceries. Specifically, the elderly often struggle with technology, making it challenging for them to access virtual supermarkets. Additionally, those living in remote areas may not have easy access to technology, further hindering their ability to buy groceries online.Despite these drawbacks, online shopping offers numerous advantages, particularly for those who are tech-savvy. Firstly, it is a significant time-saver. Shoppers can effortlessly order items with just a few clicks, selecting their desired products, payment methods, and delivery times. This has been especially beneficial during the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, where social distancing measures have been implemented in various parts of Vietnam. According to surveys, the number of online shoppers has been increasing daily, leading to the development and proliferation of numerous online shopping applications.Another significant advantage of virtual shopping is its potential to be life-saving during a pandemic. Physically visiting supermarkets can be hazardous due to the risk of viral transmission and infection. For instance, going out to purchase something as simple as bread for breakfast can expose individuals to infectious or incubated Covid-19 victims. Moreover, with Covid-19 containment measures in place, such as restrictions on leaving home to purchase essential goods, not knowing how to make an online order can make survival during a pandemic extremely challenging.In conclusion, the utilization of technology for virtual shopping is beneficial in terms of saving time and lives, despite being unfamiliar to some individuals. In my opinion, given its numerous advantages, I will continue to shop online, even after the world has successfully navigated the Covid-19 pandemic.

llm: In today's world, technological advancements have led to the creation of numerous innovative inventions. In conclusion, the internet is a highly successful and modern tool that has revolutionized the way we access information and communicate with one another in a remarkably short period.
